verses.text: ن‌ وَ الْقَلَمِ‌ وَ مَا يَسْطُرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: ن، سوگند به قلم و آنچه می نویسند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: نون، سوگند به قلم و آنچه مى‌نويسند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: نون. سوگند به قلم و آنچه مى‌نويسند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: نون، سوگند به قلم و آنچه مى‌نويسند،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: ن (قسم به نون که شاید نام نور و ناصر حق یا لوح نور خداست) و قسم به قلم (علم فعلی ازلی) و آنچه (تا ابد در لوح محفوظ عالم) خواهند نگاشت.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: نون. سوگند به قلم! و قسم به چیزی که می‌نویسند! [[«ن»: از حروف مقطّعه است (نگا: بقره / 1). «الْقَلَمِ»: خامه (نگا: علق / 4). «یَسْطُرُونَ»: می‌نویسند. می‌نگارند. سوگند خوردن خدا به خامه و نوشتار، بیانگر عظمت صاحبان قلم، و حرمت نوشته‌ها در آئین اسلام است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: ن [نون‌]، سوگند به قلم و آنچه نویسند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ن، سوگند به قلم و آنچه مینویسند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: ن سوگند به قلم و آنچه نویسند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: نون، سوگند به قلم و آنچه مى‌نويسند،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: ن، سوگند به قلم و آنچه (با آن) می‌نگارند،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: NUN. I CALL to witness the pen and what they inscribe,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Nuun* – by oath of the pen and by oath of what is written by it. (Alphabet of the Arabic language; Allah and to whomever He reveals, know their precise meanings.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Nun. By the Pen, and what they inscribe,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Nun By the pen and by that which they inscribe.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Nun. [These letters (Nun, etc.) are one of the miracles of the Quran, and none but Allah (Alone) knows their meanings]. By the pen and what the (angels) write (in the Records of men).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Noon. By the pen, and by what they inscribe.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Nun. By the pen and what the scribes write.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Nun. By the pen and by what they Yastur.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Nun. By the pen and that which they write (therewith),

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Nun. By the Pen and what they write:

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Noon. By the Pen and that (the angels) write,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Nun. By the pen and what they inscribe,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Nun. By the pen and by what you write,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Noon. I swear by the pen and what the angels write,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Noon waalqalami wama yasturoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Nun. By the pen, and all that they write!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Nun. By the Pen and the (Record) which (men) write,-

verses.text: مَا أَنْتَ‌ بِنِعْمَةِ رَبِّکَ‌ بِمَجْنُونٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: که به سبب نعمت و رحمت پروردگارت [که نبوّت، دانش و بصیرت است] تو مجنون نیستی؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: كه تو، به فضل پروردگارت، ديوانه نيستى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: كه تو، به لطف پروردگارت، مجنون نيستى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [كه‌] تو، به لطف پروردگارت، ديوانه نيستى.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که تو به لطف و رحمت پروردگارت هرگز دیوانه نیستی.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: در سایه‌ی نعمت و لطف پروردگارت، تو دیوانه نیستی. [[«بِنِعْمَةِ»: در سایه نعمت. به لطف (نگا: طور / 29). «بِمَجْنُونٍ»: حرف باء زائد و برای تأکید نفی است. این آیه ردّ یاوه‌سرائیهای کافران و مشرکان است که مظهر عقل و درایت، و منبع نور و هدایت، و صفوت آدمیان و تَتِمّه دَور زمان را دیوانه می‌نامیدند (نگا: حجر / 6، قلم / 51).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: تو -به لطف پروردگارتدیوانه نیستی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: که به نعمت پروردگارت تو مجنون نیستی،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: نیستی تو به نعمت پروردگارت دیوانه‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: كه تو به نعمت پروردگارت- نبوت و رسالت- ديوانه نيستى.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: که) تو، با نعمت (پرورش وحی از) پروردگارت، دیوانه نیستی.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: You are not demented by the grace of your Lord.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: You are not insane, by the munificence of your Lord.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: thou art not, by the blessing of thy Lord, a man possessed.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Thou art nor, through the grace of thy Lord, mad.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: You (O Muhammad SAW) are not, by the Grace of your Lord, a madman.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: By the grace of your Lord, you are not insane.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: By your Lord's Grace, you are not afflicted with madness,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: You, by the grace of your Lord, are not insane.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Thou art not, for thy Lord's favour unto thee, a madman.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: by your Lord’s blessing, you are not, crazy,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: you are not, because of the favor of your Lord, mad.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: You are not, [O Muhammad], by the favor of your Lord, a madman.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), you are not insane, thanks to the bounty of your Lord.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: By the grace of your Lord you are not mad.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ma anta biniAAmati rabbika bimajnoonin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: By the grace of your Lord, you are not a mad man.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Thou art not, by the Grace of thy Lord, mad or possessed.

verses.text: وَ إِنَ‌ لَکَ‌ لَأَجْراً غَيْرَ مَمْنُونٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و بی تردید برای تو پاداشی دایم و همیشگی است؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و تو راست پاداشى پايان‌ناپذير.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و بى‌گمان، تو را پاداشى بى‌منت [و بى‌پايان‌] خواهد بود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و بى‌گمان، تو را پاداشى بى‌منت خواهد بود.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و البته تو را پاداشی نامحدود است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: تو دارای پاداش بزرگ و ناگسیختنی هستی. [[«غَیْرَ مَمْنُونٍ»: نامقطوع. یعنی ماندگار و همیشگی.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و تو را پاداشی ناکاسته [/بی‌منت‌] است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و برای تو پاداشی عظیم و همیشگی است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا تو را است مزدی بی‌منت (یا بی‌پایان)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه تو راست مزد بى‌پايان.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و بی‌گمان، تو را همواره پاداشی بی‌‌منت و پایدار است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: There is surely reward unending for you,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed for you is an unlimited reward.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Surely thou shalt have a wage unfailing;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And verily thine shall be a hire unending."

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And verily, for you (O Muhammad SAW) will be an endless reward.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: In fact, you will have a reward that will never end.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and surely yours shall be a never-ending reward,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And verily, for you will be reward that is not Mamnun.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And lo! thine verily will be a reward unfailing.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and yours indeed will be an everlasting reward,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Indeed, there is an unfailing wage for you.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And indeed, for you is a reward uninterrupted.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: You will certainly receive a never-ending reward.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And most surely you shall have a reward never to be cut off.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wainna laka laajran ghayra mamnoonin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Most surely, you will have a never ending reward.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Nay, verily for thee is a Reward unfailing:

verses.text: وَ إِنَّکَ‌ لَعَلَى‌ خُلُقٍ‌ عَظِيمٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و یقیناً تو بر بلندای سجایای اخلاقی عظیمی قرار داری.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و تو راست خُلقى عظيم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و به راستى تو بر خلق و خوى بس بزرگى هستى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و راستى كه تو را خويى والاست

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و در حقیقت تو به نیکو خلقی عظیم آراسته‌ای.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: تو دارای خوی سترگ (یعنی صفات پسندیده و افعال حمیده) هستی. [[«خُلُقٍ»: خوی. مراد رفتار و کردار است (نگا: شعراء / 137).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و تو دارای اخلاق بسیار بزرگوارانه‌ای هستی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و تو اخلاق عظیم و برجسته‌ای داری!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا توئی بر خوئی بزرگ‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه تويى بر خويى بس بزرگ.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (که) در کدام یک از شما (عقلی) آتشبار (و) آشفته است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: For you are verily born of sublime nature.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed you possess an exemplary character.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: surely thou art upon a mighty morality.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And verily thou art of a high and noble disposition.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And verily, you (O Muhammad SAW) are on an exalted standard of character.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And you are of a great moral character.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and you are certainly on the most exalted standard of moral excellence.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And verily, you are on an exalted character.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And lo! thou art of a tremendous nature.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and indeed you possess a great character.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Surely, you (Prophet Muhammad) are of a great morality.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And indeed, you are of a great moral character.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: You have attained a high moral standard.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And most surely you conform (yourself) to sublime morality.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wainnaka laAAala khuluqin AAatheemin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: For you are truly of a sublime character.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And thou (standest) on an exalted standard of character.

verses.text: فَسَتُبْصِرُ وَ يُبْصِرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس به زودی می بینی و [منکران هم] می بینند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: زودا كه تو ببينى و آنها نيز ببينند،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس به زودى خواهى ديد و خواهند ديد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: به زودى خواهى ديد و خواهند ديد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و به زودی تو و مخالفانت مشاهده می‌کنید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: خواهی دید و خواهند دید. [[«فَسَتُبْصِرُ ...»: به زودی خواهی دید و متوجّه خواهی شد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: زودا که بنگری و بنگرند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و بزودی تو می‌بینی و آنان نیز می‌بینند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس زود است بنگری و بنگرند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس زودا كه ببينى و آنها نيز ببينند،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و به‌راستی که تو بر خُلقی بس بزرگ سلطه داری.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So you will see, and they will realise,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So very soon, you will see and they too will realise –

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So thou shalt see, and they will see,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Anon thou wilt see and they will see:

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: You will see, and they will see,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: You will see, and they will see.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: So you will soon see, and they too will see,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: You will see, and they will see,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And thou wilt see and they will see

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: You will see and they will see,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: You shall see and they will see

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So you will see and they will see

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: You will see and they will also see

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So you shall see, and they (too) shall see,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fasatubsiru wayubsiroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Soon you will see, as will they,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Soon wilt thou see, and they will see,

verses.text: بِأَيِّکُمُ‌ الْمَفْتُونُ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: که کدام یک از شما دچار جنون اند؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: كه ديوانگى در كدام يك از شماست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: كه كدام يك از شما مجنون است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [كه‌] كدام يك از شما دستخوش جنونيد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که از شما کدام یک (به اوهام و خیالات باطل) مفتون و دیوانه‌اند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: که کدام یک از شما مبتلا به دیوانگی است (محمّد، یا شما کافران و مشرکان). [[«الْمَفْتُونُ»: دیوانگی. مصدر است، مانند معقول به معنی عقل، مَجْلُود به معنی جَلادَة (نگا: روح‌البیان). در این صورت حرف (ب) در اوّل (بِأَییِّکُمْ) به معنی (فی) است (نگا: صفوة‌البیان). برخی هم حرف باء را زائد دانسته و (مفتون) را اسم مفعول محسوب نموده‌اند. در این صورت معنی آیه چنین است: که کدام یک از شما دیوانه است (نگا: روح المعانی).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: که کدامیک از شما دیوانه‌اید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: که کدام یک از شما مجنونند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: کدامیک از شمائید فریب‌خورده (کم خرد)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: كه كدامين شما ديوانه و شوريده است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس به زودی خواهی دید و خواهند دید،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Who is distracted.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: - That who among you was insane.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: which of you is the demented.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Which of you is afflicted with madness.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Which of you is afflicted with madness.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Which of you is the afflicted.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: which of you is afflicted with madness.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Which of you is afflicted with madness.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Which of you is the demented.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: which one of you is crazy.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: which of you is the demented.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Which of you is the afflicted [by a devil].

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: which of you has been afflicted by insanity.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Which of you is afflicted with madness.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Biayyikumu almaftoonu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: which of you is a prey to madness.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Which of you is afflicted with madness.

verses.text: إِنَ‌ رَبَّکَ‌ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ‌ بِمَنْ‌ ضَلَ‌ عَنْ‌ سَبِيلِهِ‌ وَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ‌ بِالْمُهْتَدِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بی تردید پروردگارت بهتر می داند چه کسی از راه او گمراه شده، و او به راه یافتگان داناتر است. ….

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: هر آينه پروردگار تو بهتر مى‌داند چه كسى از طريق او گمراه گشته، كه او به ره‌يافتگان داناتر است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بى‌گمان، پروردگار تو كسى را كه از راه او منحرف شده، بهتر مى‌شناسد، و او به راه‌يافتگان داناتر است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پروردگارت خود بهتر مى‌داند چه كسى از راه او منحرف شده، و [هم‌] او به راه يافتگان داناتر است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: البته خدایت داناتر است که از راه خدا گمراه کیست و بهتر می‌داند که هدایت یافتگان عالم کیانند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پروردگار تو مسلّماً (از هر کس دیگری) بهتر می‌داند که چه کسی از راه او گمراه شده است، و چه کسی راهیاب است. [[«إِنَّ رَبَّکَ ... بِالْمُهْتَدِینَ»: (نگا: انعام / 117، نحل / 125، نجم / 30).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بی‌گمان پروردگارت به کسی که از راه او گم گشته و به رهیافتگان آگاه‌تر است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: پروردگارت بهتر از هر کس می‌داند چه کسی از راه او گمراه شده، و هدایت‌یافتگان را نیز بهتر می‌شناسد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: هر آینه پروردگارت داناتر است بدانکه گمراه است از راه او و او است داناتر به راه‌یافتگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا پروردگارت داناتر است به كسى كه از راه او گم گشته و داناتر است به ره‌يافتگان.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: همانا پروردگارت، (هم)او بهتر می‌داند چه کسی از راهش منحرف شده، و (هم) او به راه‌یافتگان داناتر است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Verily your Lord knows those who have gone astray from His path, and He knows those who are guided on the way.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed your Lord well knows those who have strayed from His path, and He well knows those who are upon guidance.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Surely thy Lord knows very well those who have gone astray from His way, and He knows very well those who are guided.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily thy Lord! He is the best Knower of him who strayeth from His path, and He is the best Knower of the guided one,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, your Lord knows better, who (among men) has gone astray from His Path, and He knows better those who are guided.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Your Lord knows best who has strayed from His path, and He knows best the well-guided.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Surely your Lord knows well those who have strayed from His Way just as He knows well those who are on the Right Way.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, your Lord is the best Knower of him who has gone astray from His path, and He is the best Knower of those who are guided.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! thy Lord is Best Aware of him who strayeth from His way, and He is Best Aware of those who walk aright.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed your Lord knows best those who stray from His way, and He knows best those who are guided.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Indeed, your Lord knows very well those who strayed from His Path, and those who are guided.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has gone astray from His way, and He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Your Lord knows best who has gone astray from His path and who is rightly guided.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely your Lord best knows him who errs from His way, and He best knows the followers of the right course.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna rabbaka huwa aAAlamu biman dalla AAan sabeelihi wahuwa aAAlamu bialmuhtadeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Your Lord knows best who has fallen by the wayside, and who has remained on the true path.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Verily it is thy Lord that knoweth best, which (among men) hath strayed from His Path: and He knoweth best those who receive (true) Guidance.

verses.text: فَلاَ تُطِعِ‌ الْمُکَذِّبِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: از تکذیب کنندگان [قرآن و نبوّت] فرمان مبر.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس، از تكذيب كنندگان، اطاعت مكن.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس از تكذيب كنندگان اطاعت مكن

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس، از دروغزنان فرمان مبر.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس هرگز از مردم کافری که آیات خدا را تکذیب می‌کنند پیروی مکن.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: حال که چنین است، از تکذیب کنندگان اطاعت و پیروی مکن (و بر دعوت خود پایدار باش و به راه آنان مرو. اطاعت از ایشان گمراهی و بدبختی است). [[«لا تُطِعْ ...»: مراد تشویق و ترغیب پیغمبر و همه پیروان او است که راه خدا را با شوق و شور ادامه دهند، و با کفّار و مشرکین نرمش و سازش نکنند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس از منکران اطاعت مکن‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: حال که چنین است از تکذیب‌کنندگان اطاعت مکن!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس فرمانبری مکن تکذیب‌کنندگان را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس دروغ‌انگاران را فرمان مبر.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس، از تکذیب‌کنندگان فرمان مبر.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So do not comply with those who deny:

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Therefore do not listen to the deniers.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So obey thou not those who cry lies.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Wherefore obey not thou the beliers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So (O Muhammad SAW) obey not the deniers [(of Islamic Monotheism those who belie the Verses of Allah), the Oneness of Allah, and the Messenger of Allah (Muhammad SAW), etc.]

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So do not obey the deniers.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Do not, then, yield to those who reject the Truth, decrying it as false;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So, do not obey the deniers.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Therefor obey not thou the rejecters

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So do not obey the deniers,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Therefore, do not obey those who belie,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then do not obey the deniers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do not yield to those who reject the Truth.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So do not yield to the rejecters.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fala tutiAAi almukaththibeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Do not give in to the deniers of truth.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So hearken not to those who deny (the Truth).

verses.text: وَدُّوا لَوْ تُدْهِنُ‌ فَيُدْهِنُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: دوست دارند نرمی کنی تا نرمی کنند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: دوست دارند كه نرمى كنى تا نرمى كنند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [آنها] دوست دارند كه سازش كنى تا سازش كنند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: دوست دارند كه نرمى كنى تا نرمى نمايند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: کافران بسیار مایلند که تو با آنها مداهنه و مداراکنی (و متعرض بتهاشان نشوی) تا آنها هم (به نفاق) با تو مداهنه و مدارا کنند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ایشان دوست می‌دارند که نرمش و سازش نشان دهی، تا آنان هم نرمش و سازش کنند (بدین امید که برخی از فرمانهای خدا را به خاطر آنان ترک کنی، و در بعضی از مسائل با ایشان همگام و همآهنگ شوی). [[«تُدْهِنُ»: سهل انگاری کنی. نرمش و سازش نمائی ... مراد آنان این است که پیغمبر با نزدیک شدن به دین آنان، روی خوش بدیشان نشان دهد، و آنان هم با نزدیک شدن به دین اسلام روی خوش نشان دهند. یعنی سهل‌انگاری و سازش انجام پذیرد. (نگا: واقعه / 81).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: خوش دارند که با آنان سازگاری کنی تا با تو سازگاری کنند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها دوست دارند نرمش نشان دهی تا آنها (هم) نرمش نشان دهند (نرمشی توأم با انحراف از مسیر حق)!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: دوست داشتند کنار آبی (چاپلوسی کنی) تا کنار آیند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: دوست دارند كه نرمى كنى تا نرمى كنند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: دوست داشتند اگر (با آنان) نرمی کنی تا (با تو) نرمی نمایند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They only want that you should relent, so that they may come to terms.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They wish that in some way you may yield, so they too might soften their stand.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They wish that thou shouldst compromise, then they would compromise.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Fain would they that thou shouldst be pliant, so that they will be pliant.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They wish that you should compromise (in religion out of courtesy) with them, so they (too) would compromise with you.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They would like you to compromise, so they would compromise.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: they would wish you to be pliant so that they too may be pliant.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They wish that you should compromise with them, so they (too) would compromise with you.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Who would have had thee compromise, that they may compromise.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: who are eager that you should be flexible, so that they [too] may be flexible [towards you].

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: they wish you would compromise, then, they would compromise.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: They wish that you would soften [in your position], so they would soften [toward you].

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They would like you to relent to them so that they could also relent towards you.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: They wish that you should be pliant so they (too) would be pliant.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waddoo law tudhinu fayudhinoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They want you to make concessions to them and then they will reciprocate.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Their desire is that thou shouldst be pliant: so would they be pliant.

verses.text: وَ لاَ تُطِعْ‌ کُلَ‌ حَلاَّفٍ‌ مَهِينٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و از هر سوگند خورده زبون و فرومایه فرمان مبر،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: از هر فرومايه‌اى كه بسيار سوگند مى‌خورد، پيروى مكن:

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و از هيچ سوگند پيشه فرومايه‌اى اطاعت نكن

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و از هر قسم خورنده فرو مايه‌اى فرمان مبر:

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و تو هرگز اطاعت مکن احدی از منافقان دون را که دایم (به دروغ) سوگند می‌خورند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: از فرومایه‌ای که بسیار سوگند می‌خورد، پیروی مکن. [[«حَلاّفٍ»: بسیار سوگند خورنده. به حق یا به ناحق. «مَهِینٍ»: خوار و پست. رَذْل و حقیر.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و از هیچ بیهوده سوگند خوار پستی اطاعت مکن‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و از کسی که بسیار سوگند یاد می‌کند و پست است اطاعت مکن،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و فرمان نبر هر فراوان سوگندخورنده زبونی را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر بسيار سوگند خورنده خوار و بى‌ارزشى را فرمان مبر،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و از هر قسم‌خورنده‌ی بی‌مبالات بس فرومایه‌ای فرمان مبر،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Do not heed a contemptible swearer,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Nor ever listen to any excessive oath maker, ignoble person.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And obey thou not every mean swearer,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And obey not: thou any swearer ignominous.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And obey not everyone who swears much, and is considered worthless,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And do not obey any vile swearer.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And do not yield to any contemptible swearer,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And do not obey every Hallaf Mahin.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Neither obey thou each feeble oath-monger,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And do not obey any vile swearer,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And do not obey every mean swearer,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And do not obey every worthless habitual swearer

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do not yield to one persistent in swearing,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And yield not to any mean swearer

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wala tutiAA kulla hallafin maheenin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Do not yield to any contemptible swearer of oaths,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Heed not the type of despicable men,- ready with oaths,

verses.text: هَمَّازٍ مَشَّاءٍ بِنَمِيمٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آنکه بسیار عیب جوست، و برای سخن چینی در رفت و آمد است،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: عيبجويى كه براى سخن‌چينى اينجا و آنجا مى‌رود،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: كه عيبجوست و براى خبرچينى [به هر جا] رونده است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [كه‌] عيبجوست و براى خبرچينى گام برمى‌دارد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و آن کس که دایم عیبجویی و سخن‌چینی می‌کند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بسیار عیبجوئی که دائماً سخن‌چینی می‌کند. [[«هَمَّازٍ»: بسیار عیبجو. رخنه‌گر. بسیار بدگو و بد زبان. «مَشَّآءٍ»: پادو. تیزرونده. در اینجا با حرف (ب) متعدّی شده و به معنی بسیار بَرنده و نقل‌کننده است. «مَشَّآءٍ بِنَمِیمٍ»: بسیار سخن چین. کسی که سخن این را برای آن، و کلام آن را برای این، به منظور فساد و تباهی می‌آورد و می‌برد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: عیبجوی روانه در پی سخن‌چینی‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: کسی که بسیار عیبجوست و به سخن چینی آمد و شد می‌کند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: نکوهش گری پوینده به سخن چینی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: كه عيبجو، بدگو، رونده به سخن‌چينى،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (که) بسیار عیب‌جوست و برای خبرچینی پیاپی گام برمی‌دارد،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Or backbiter, calumniator, slanderer,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: The excessively insulting one, spreader of spite.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: backbiter, going about with slander,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: A defamer, spreader abroad of slander.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: A slanderer, going about with calumnies,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Backbiter, spreader of slander.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: the fault-finder who goes around slandering,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: A Hammaz, going about with Namim,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Detracter, spreader abroad of slanders,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: scandal-monger, talebearer,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: the backbiter who goes about slandering,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [And] scorner, going about with malicious gossip -

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: back-biting, gossiping,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Defamer, going about with slander

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Hammazin mashshain binameemin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: or to any defamer or one who spreads slander,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: A slanderer, going about with calumnies,

verses.text: مَنَّاعٍ‌ لِلْخَيْرِ مُعْتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: به شدت بازدارنده [مردم] از کار خیر و متجاوز و گنهکار است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بازدارنده از خير، متجاوز گناهكار،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بسيار مانع خير، متجاوز و گناه‌پيشه است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: مانع خير، متجاوز، گناه پيشه،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و خلق را هر چه بتواند از خیر باز می‌دارد و به ظلم و بدکاری می‌کوشد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بسیار مانع کار خیر، و تجاوز پیشه، و بزهکار است. [[«مَنَّاعٍ»: کسی که خویشتن را بسیار دور از خیرات و حسنات نگاه می‌دارد که کنایه از بخیل و تنگ‌چشم است. بسیار بازدارنده مردم از انجام خیرات و حسنات (نگا: ق / 25). «مُعْتَدٍ»: متجاوز. تجاوز پیشه (نگا: بقره / 190، مائده / 87، توبه / 10). «أَثِیمٍ»: (نگا: بقره / 276، نساء / 107، شعراء / 222).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: باز دارنده، از نیکی، تجاوزگر گناهکار

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و بسیار مانع کار خیر، و متجاوز و گناهکار است؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بسیار بازدارنده از نیکی تجاوزکننده گنهکاری‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بازدارنده نيكى، از حد درگذرنده، گنه‌پيشه،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و بسی مانع از خیر، متجاوز و گناه‌پیشه است،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Who hinders men from (doing) good, the transgressor, the iniquitous,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: One who excessively forbids the good, transgressor, sinner.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: hinderer of good, guilty aggressor, coarse-grained,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Hinderer of the good, trespasser; sinner.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Hinderer of the good, transgressor, sinful,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Preventer of good, transgressor, sinner.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: the hinderer of good, the transgressor, the sinful;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Hinderer of the good, transgressor, sinful,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Hinderer of the good, transgressor, malefactor

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: hinderer of all good, sinful transgressor,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: those who hinder good, the guilty aggressor,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: A preventer of good, transgressing and sinful,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: obstructing virtues, a sinful transgressor,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Forbidder of good, outstepping the limits, sinful,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: MannaAAin lilkhayri muAAtadin atheemin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: or to one who places obstacles in the way of good being done or to the wicked transgressor,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: (Habitually) hindering (all) good, transgressing beyond bounds, deep in sin,

verses.text: عُتُلٍ‌ بَعْدَ ذٰلِکَ‌ زَنِيمٍ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گذشته از این ها کینه توز و بی اصل و نسب است،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: خشن‌مردى، ناشناخته نسب،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گذشته از آن درشت‌خوى، بى‌تبار و بدنام است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گستاخ، [و] گذشته از آن زنازاده است،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: با این همه عیب، باز متکبر است و خشن با آنکه حرامزاده و بی‌اصل و نسب است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: علاوه بر اینها درشتخوی و سنگین دل، و انگشت نما به بدیها است. [[«عُتُلٍّ»: درشتخو. سنگین دل. سخت روی و زشتخوی (نگا: روح‌البیان). «زَنیِمٍ»: نشاندار به هرچه بدی و زشتی است. حرامزاده. البتّه کسی که مجمع بدیها و منبع زشتیها باشد، ناانسان و ناکس بشمار است، و از زمره انسانها محسوب نمی‌گردد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: درشت‌خوی، و بعد از این همه، ناپاکزاد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: علاوه بر اینها کینه توز و پرخور و خشن و بدنام است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: درشتخوئی پس از آن بی‌تباری‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [و] پس از اين همه، سختدل و درشت‌خو و بى‌تبار است

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: ترک‌کننده‌ی تمامی فضیلت‌ها و عمل‌کننده‌ی به همه‌ی رذیلت‌ها (و) پس از آن بی‌تبار است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Crude, and above all, mean and infamous,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Foul mouthed, and in addition to all this, of improper lineage.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: moreover ignoble,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Gross, and therewithal ignoble-

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Cruel, after all that base-born (of illegitimate birth),

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Rude and fake besides.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: the coarse-grained, and above all mean and ignoble;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: `Utul, and moreover Zanim.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Greedy therewithal, intrusive.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: callous and, on top of that, baseborn

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: the crude of low character

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Cruel, moreover, and an illegitimate pretender.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: ill-mannered, and moraly corrupt or that because he may possess wealth and children.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Ignoble, besides all that, base-born;

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: AAutullin baAAda thalika zaneemin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: who is ignoble and besides all that, base-born;

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Violent (and cruel),- with all that, base-born,-

verses.text: أَنْ‌ کَانَ‌ ذَا مَالٍ‌ وَ بَنِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [سرکشی و یاغی گری اش] برای آن [است] که دارای ثروت و فرزندان فراوان است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بدان جهت كه صاحب مال و فرزند است،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: به صرف اين كه مالدار و صاحب پسران است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: به صرف اينكه مالدار و پسردار است،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (پیرو چنین کسی) برای این که مال و فرزندان بسیار دارد (نباید شد).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (آیا این همه زشتیها و پلشتیها) بدان خاطر است که دارا و دارای فرزندان است؟! [[«أَنْ ...»: بدان سبب که ... حرف (أَنْ) مصدریّه است. لام جرّی قبل از آن محذوف است، یعنی (لاِنْ). برخی هم حرف استفهامی نیز محذوف دانسته‌اند و گفته‌اند اصل چنین است: أَلِأَنْ ...]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: به خاطر آنکه مالدار است و صاحب پسران‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: مبادا بخاطر اینکه صاحب مال و فرزندان فراوان است (از او پیروی کنی)!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: که هست دارای خواسته و فرزندانی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: از آن رو كه داراى مال و پسران است

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (برای) اینکه صاحب مال و پسرانی بوده،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Simply because he possesses wealth and children.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Because he* has some wealth and sons. (Walid bin Mugaira, who cursed the Holy Prophet.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: because he has wealth and sons.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Because he is owner of riches and children.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (He was so) because he had wealth and children.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Just because he has money and children.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (who so acts) simply because he has wealth and sons,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: (He was so) because he had wealth and children.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: It is because he is possessed of wealth and children

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: —[who behaves in such a manner only] because he has wealth and children.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: because he has wealth and sons.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Because he is a possessor of wealth and children,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: When Our revelations are recited to him,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Because he possesses wealth and sons.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: An kana tha malin wabaneena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: just because he has wealth and sons,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Because he possesses wealth and (numerous) sons.

verses.text: إِذَا تُتْلَى‌ عَلَيْهِ‌ آيَاتُنَا قَالَ‌ أَسَاطِيرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: هنگامی که آیات ما را بر او می خوانند، گوید: افسانه های پیشینیان است!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چون آيات ما بر او خوانده شود، گويد: اساطير پيشينيان است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: چون آيات ما بر او خوانده شود گويد: افسانه‌هاى پيشينيان است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: چون آيات ما بر او خوانده شود، گويد: «افسانه‌هاى پيشينيان است.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: در صورتی که چون آیات ما را بر او تلاوت کنند گوید: این سخنان افسانه پیشینیان است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هنگامی که آیه‌های ما بر او خوانده می‌شود، می‌گوید: افسانه‌های پیشینیان است. [[«أَسَاطِیرُ الأَوَّلِینَ»: (نگا: انعام / 25، انفال / 31، نحل / 24).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: چون آیات ما بر او خوانده شود، گوید افسانه‌های پیشینیان است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هنگامی که آیات ما بر او خوانده می‌شود می‌گوید: «اینها افسانه‌های خرافی پیشینیان است!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: هر گاه خوانده شود بر او آیتهای ما گوید افسانه‌های پیشینیان است‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: چون آيات ما بر او خوانده شود گويد: افسانه‌هاى پيشينيان است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: هنگامی که آیاتمان بر او خوانده شود گوید: «(این‌ها) افسانه‌های پیشینیان است.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When you recite Our revelations to him, he says: "These are fables of long ago."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, “These are stories of earlier people.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: When Our signs are recited to him, he says, 'Fairy-tales of the ancients!'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: When Our revelations are rehearsed Unto him, he saith: fables of the ancients.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: When Our Verses (of the Quran) are recited to him, he says: "Tales of the men of old!"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: When Our Verses are recited to him, he says, “Myths of the ancients!”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and whenever Our verses are rehearsed to him, he says: “These are fairy- tales of times gone by.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: When Our Ayat are recited to him, he says: "Tales of the men of old!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: That, when Our revelations are recited unto him, he saith: Mere fables of the men of old.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: When Our signs are recited to him, he says, ‘Myths of the ancients!’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: When Our verses are recited to him, he says: 'They are but fairytales of the ancients'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Legends of the former peoples."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: he says, "These are ancient legends".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: When Our communications are recited to him, he says: Stories of those of yore.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Itha tutla AAalayhi ayatuna qala asateeru alawwaleena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: when Our revelations are recited to him, he says, "These are just ancient fables."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: When to him are rehearsed Our Signs, "Tales of the ancients", he cries!

verses.text: سَنَسِمُهُ‌ عَلَى‌ الْخُرْطُومِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: به زودی بر بینیِ [پر باد و خرطوم مانند] ش داغ رسوایی و خواری می نهیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: زودا كه بر بينى‌اش داغ گذاريم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: زودا كه بر بينى‌اش داغ نهيم [و رسوايش كنيم‌]

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: زودا كه بر بينى‌اش داغ نهيم [و رسوايش كنيم‌].

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: به زودی بر خرطوم و بینی‌اش داغ (شمشیر) نهیم. (این آیات در حقّ ولید مغیره عمّ ابو جهل که روز بدر بر حسب وعده حق به شمشیر علی علیه السلام بینی‌اش بشکافت نازل آمد ولی بر هر که مانند اوست تا ابد شامل است).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما بر بینی او داغ (ننگ) می‌نهیم. [[«سَنَسِمُهُ»: علامتگذاریش خواهیم کرد. داغش خواهیم کرد.. «الْخُرْطُومِ»: بینی. در اصل به بینی حیوانات به ویژه فیل گفته می‌شود و کنایه از خوار کردن و رسوا نمودن است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: زودا که بر بینی او نشانه‌ای بگذاریم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (ولی) ما بزودی بر بینی او علامت و داغ ننگ می‌نهیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: زود است مُهر نهیمش به پیشانی (داغ بر بینی)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بر خرطوم- بينى- او داغ خواهيم نهاد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: زودا که بر (بینی همچون) خرطوم(اش) داغ (رسوایی) نهیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We shall brand him on the muzzle.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: We will soon singe his pig-nose.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: We shall brand him upon the muzzle!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Anon We shall brand him on snout.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: We shall brand him over the nose!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We will brand him on the muzzle.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Soon shall We brand him on his snout.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: We shall brand him on the snout (nose)!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: We shall brand him on the nose.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Soon We shall brand him on his snout.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We shall mark him upon his nose!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: We will brand him upon the snout.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We shall brand him on his nose.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: We will brand him on the nose.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Sanasimuhu AAala alkhurtoomi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Soon We will brand him on the nose.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Soon shall We brand (the beast) on the snout!

verses.text: إِنَّا بَلَوْنَاهُمْ‌ کَمَا بَلَوْنَا أَصْحَابَ‌ الْجَنَّةِ إِذْ أَقْسَمُوا لَيَصْرِمُنَّهَا مُصْبِحِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بی تردید ما آنان را [که در مکه بودند] آزمودیم همان گونه که صاحبان آن باغ را [در منطقه یمن] آزمودیم، هنگامی که سوگند خوردند که صبحگاهان حتماً میوه های باغ را بچینند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: ما آنها را آزموديم، چنان كه صاحبان آن بستانها را آزموديم. آنگاه كه قسم خوردند كه فردا بامداد ميوه‌ها را خواهند چيد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: ما آنها (مشركان) را گرفتار و مبتلا كرديم، همان گونه كه باغداران را گرفتار ساختيم، آن‌گاه كه سوگند خوردند كه: صبحگاهان آن [ميوه‌هاى باغ‌] را [دور از چشم مستمندان‌] خواهيم چيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: ما آنان را همان گونه كه باغداران را آزموديم، مورد آزمايش قرار داديم، آنگاه كه سوگند خوردند كه صبح برخيزند و [ميوه‌] آن [باغ‌] را حتماً بچينند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: ما کافران را (به قحط و سختی) آزمودیم چنانکه اهل آن بستان را آزمودیم، که قسم خوردند که صبحگاه میوه‌اش را بچینند (تا فقیران آگاه نشوند).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ما آنان را آزموده‌ایم، همان گونه که صاحبان باغ را آزموده‌ایم. هنگامی که سوگند یاد کردند که میوه‌های باغ را بامدادان (دور از انظار مردم) بچینند. [[«بَلَوْنَاهُمْ»: ایشان را آزمودیم. آنان را آزمایش کردیم. مراد از (هُمْ) مشرکان مکّه است. «لَیَصْرِمُنَّهَا»: آن را خواهند چید. «مُصْبِحِینَ»: در حالی که به بامدادان برسند. حال فاعل (لَیَصْرِمُنَّهَا) است. از (أَصْبَحَ) تامّه است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: ما آنان را آزموده‌ایم، همچنانکه باغداران را هم آزموده‌ایم، آنگاه که سوگند خوردند که صبحگاهان میوه‌های آن را بازچینند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ما آنها را آزمودیم، همان گونه که «صاحبان باغ» را آزمایش کردیم، هنگامی که سوگند یاد کردند که میوه‌های باغ را صبحگاهان (دور از چشم مستمندان) بچینند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا آزمودیم ایشان را چنانکه آزمودیم یاران بهشت را گاهی که سوگند یاد کردند که برندش البته بامدادکنان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: ما آنها- اهل مكه- را بيازموديم- به آنها نعمت داديم ولى كفر ورزيدند- چنانكه خداوندان آن بوستان را آزموديم آنگاه كه سوگند خوردند كه هر آينه بامداد پگاه- پنهان از مستمندان- ميوه آن را خواهيم چيد

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: ما بی‌گمان آنان را همان گونه که باغداران را آزمودیم، -چون سوگند خوردند بی‌چون صبحگاهان برخیزند و (میوه‌ی) آن (باغ) را همواره برچینند- مورد آزمایش قرار دادیم.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We have tried you as We tried the owners of the garden when they vowed to gather the fruits in the morning

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: We have indeed tested them the way We had tested the owners of the garden when they swore that they would reap its harvest the next morning.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Now We have tried them, even as We tried the owners of the garden when they swore they would pluck in the morning

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily We! We have proved them even as We proved the fellows of a garden when they swarethat they would surely reap it in the morning.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, We have tried them as We tried the people of the garden, when they swore to pluck the fruits of the (garden) in the morning,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We tested them, as We tested the owners of the garden, when they vowed to harvest it in the morning.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: We have put them [i.e., the Makkans] to test even as We put to test the owners of the orchard when they vowed that they would gather the fruit of their orchard in the morning,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, We have tried them as We tried the People of the Garden, when they swore to pluck the fruits in the morning,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! We have tried them as We tried the owners of the garden when they vowed that they would pluck its fruit next morning,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed we have tested them just as We tested the People of the Garden when they vowed they would gather its fruit at dawn,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: We have tried them as We tried the owners of the garden who had sworn that in the morning they would reap it,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, We have tried them as We tried the companions of the garden, when they swore to cut its fruit in the [early] morning

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: We have tested them in the same way as we tested the dwellers of the garden (in Yemen) when they swore to pluck all the fruits of the garden in the morning,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely We will try them as We tried the owners of the garden, when they swore that they would certainly cut off the produce in the morning,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna balawnahum kama balawna ashaba aljannati ith aqsamoo layasrimunnaha musbiheena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: We have tried them as we tried the owners of a certain orchard, who vowed to harvest all its fruits the next morning,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Verily We have tried them as We tried the People of the Garden, when they resolved to gather the fruits of the (garden) in the morning.

verses.text: وَ لاَ يَسْتَثْنُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و چیزی از آن را [برای تهیدستان و نیازمندان] استثنا نکردند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و ان شاء اللّه نگفتند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و استثنا نكردند (ان شاء اللّه نگفتند)

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و[لى‌] «ان شاء الله» نگفتند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و هیچ استثناء نکردند (ان شاء اللَه نگفتند و به خواست خدا معتقد نبودند).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و هیچ چیز از آن بر جای نگذارند. [[«لا یَسْتَثْنُونَ»: چیزی فرو نگذارند. برای مستمندان چیزی کنار نگذارند و بدیشان ندهند (نگا: انعام / 141).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و ان شاء الله نگفتند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و هیچ از آن استثنا نکنند؛

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و استثناء نکنند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و استثنا نكردند- نگفتند اگر خداى خواهد-

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: حال آنکه (این اموال را برای بینوایان) استثنا نکنند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But did not add: "If God may please."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And they did not say, “If Allah wills”.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and they added not the saving words.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And they made not the exception.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Without saying: Insha' Allah (If Allah will).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Without any reservation.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: without making any allowance (for the will of Allah).

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Without saying: "If Allah wills."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And made no exception (for the Will of Allah);

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and they did not make any exception.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: without adding to their swearing, (Allah willing, InshaAllah).

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Without making exception.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: without adding ("if God wills").

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And were not willing to set aside a portion (for the poor).

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wala yastathnoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: without saying, "If it be God's will."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But made no reservation, ("If it be Allah's Will").

verses.text: فَطَافَ‌ عَلَيْهَا طَائِفٌ‌ مِنْ‌ رَبِّکَ‌ وَ هُمْ‌ نَائِمُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس در حالی که صاحبان باغ در خواب بودند، بلایی فراگیر از سوی پروردگارت آن باغ را فرا گرفت.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس شب‌هنگام كه به خواب بودند آفتى از آسمان آمد،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس بلايى فراگير از جانب پروردگارت آن باغ را فراگرفت در حالى كه آنها خواب بودند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس در حالى كه آنان غنوده بودند، بلايى از جانب پروردگارت بر آن [باغ‌] به گردش در آمد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بدین سبب همان شب هنوز به خواب بودند که از جانب خدا آتش عذابی نازل شد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: شب هنگام که آنان در خواب بودند، بلای بزرگ و فراگیری از جانب پروردگارت سراسر باغ را در بر گرفت.

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس بلایی شبانه از جانب پروردگارت، در حالی که ایشان خفته بودند، بر آن زد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: امّا عذابی فراگیر (شب هنگام) بر (تمام) باغ آنها فرود آمد در حالی که همه در خواب بودند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس گردش کرد بر ایشان گردکننده‌ای از پروردگار تو و بودند خسبیدگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس شبانگاه كه خفته بودند آفتى از سوى پروردگارت بر گرد آن

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس در حالی که آنان خواب بودند، (بلای) گردشگری (بر سروسامانشان) از جانب پروردگارت بر آن (باغ) به گردش درآمد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then a calamity from your Lord fell upon it, but they remained fast asleep.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So an envoy from your Lord completed his round upon the garden, whilst they were sleeping.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then a visitation from thy Lord visited it, while they were sleeping,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Wherefore an encircling visitation visited it even as they slept on.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then there passed by on the (garden) something (fire) from your Lord at night and burnt it while they were asleep.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But a calamity from your Lord went around it while they slept.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Thereupon a calamity from your Lord passed over it while they were asleep,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then there passed over it a Ta'if from your Lord while they were asleep.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then a visitation from thy Lord came upon it while they slept

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then, a visitation from your Lord visited it while they were asleep.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Then, a visitation from your Lord came down upon it while they slept,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So there came upon the garden an affliction from your Lord while they were asleep.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: A visitor from your Lord circled around the garden during the night while they were asleep

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then there encompassed it a visitation from your Lord while they were sleeping.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fatafa AAalayha taifun min rabbika wahum naimoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: A calamity from your Lord befell the orchard as they slept.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then there came on the (garden) a visitation from thy Lord, (which swept away) all around, while they were asleep.

verses.text: فَأَصْبَحَتْ‌ کَالصَّرِيمِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس [آن باغ] به صورت شبی تاریک درآمد [و جز خاکستر چیزی در آن دیده نمی شد!]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و بستانها سياه شد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس آن [باغ‌] همچون زمين باير گرديد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و [باغ،] آفت زده [و زمين باير] گرديد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و بامدادان درختهای آن بستان چون خاکستری سیاه گردید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و باغ (سوخت و) همچون شب (تاریک و سیاه) گردید! [[«طَافَ عَلَیْهَا»: بر سر آن گشت زد و آن را در بر گرفت. «طَآئِفٌ»: بلای فرا گیر. «الصَّرِیم»: شب. چیده شده. با توجّه به معنی اخیر، مفهوم آیه چنین است: شب هنگام که آنان در خواب بودند، بلای بزرگ و فراگیری باغ را در بر گرفت و همچون باغی گردید که میوه‌های آن راچیده و کنده باشند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و مانند خاکستر سیاه شد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و آن باغ سرسبز همچون شب سیاه و ظلمانی شد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس بامداد کرد مانند شب تاریک (بریده)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس مانند باغى شد كه ميوه آن چيده و بريده باشند- درختانش سوخته و سياه شد-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس (آن) باغ (آکنده) همچون برکنده شد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So by the morning it seemed as though picked clean.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So in the morning it became as if harvested.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and in the morning it was as if it were a garden plucked.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then in the morning it became as though it had been reaped.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So the (garden) became black by the morning, like a pitch dark night (in complete ruins).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And in the morning it was as if picked.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and so by morning the orchard lay as though it had been fully harvested.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So by the morning, it became like As-Sarim.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And in the morning it was as if plucked.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So, by dawn it was like a harvested field.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and in the morning it was if the garden had been reaped.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And it became as though reaped.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and the garden was turned into a barren desert.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So it became as black, barren land.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faasbahat kaalssareemi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: And by morning it lay as if it had already been harvested, a barren land.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So the (garden) became, by the morning, like a dark and desolate spot, (whose fruit had been gathered).

verses.text: فَتَنَادَوْا مُصْبِحِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: وهنگام صبح یکدیگر را آوازدادند،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و سحرگاهان يكديگر را ندا دادند:

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: سپس صبحگاهان يكديگر را صدا زدند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس [باغداران‌] بامدادان يكديگر را صدا زدند،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: صبحگاه یکدیگر را صدا کردند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: سحرگاهان همدیگر را ندا در دادند. [[«تَنَادَوْا»: همدیگر را صدا زدند. «مُصْبِحِینَ»: (نگا: قلم / 17).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [آنان بی‌خبر] صبحگاهان همدیگر را فراخواندند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: صبحگاهان یکدیگر را صدا زدند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس بانگ دادند همدیگر را بامدادکنان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس بامدادان يكديگر را ندا دادند:

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس (باغداران) بامدادان یکدیگر را ندا در دادند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: At daybreak they called to each other:

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They then called out to each other at daybreak.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: In the morning they called to one another,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then they cried out Unto each other in the morning,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then they called out one to another as soon as the morning broke,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: In the morning, they called to one another.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: At daybreak they called out to one another:

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then they called out (one to another as soon) as the morning broke.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And they cried out one unto another in the morning,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: At dawn they called out to one another,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: (Then) in the morning they called out to one another, saying:

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And they called one another at morning,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: In the morning they called out to one another,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And they called out to each other in the morning,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fatanadaw musbiheena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: So they called out to each other at the break of dawn,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: As the morning broke, they called out, one to another,-

verses.text: أَنِ‌ اغْدُوا عَلَى‌ حَرْثِکُمْ‌ إِنْ‌ کُنْتُمْ‌ صَارِمِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: که اگر قصد چیدن میوه دارید بامدادان به سوی کشتزار و باغتان حرکت کنید؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اگر مى‌خواهيد ميوه بچينيد، بامدادان به كشتزار خود برويد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: كه بامدادان به سوى كشت خويش رويد اگر ميوه چينيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: كه: «اگر ميوه مى‌چينيد، بامدادان به سوى كشت خويش رويد.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که برخیزید اگر میوه بستان را خواهید چید به بستانتان روید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: اگر می‌خواهید میوه‌های خود را بچینید، صبح زود حرکت کنید و خویشتن را به کشتزار خود برسانید. [[«أُغْدُوا»: بامدادان حرکت کنید. صبح زود یورش برید. «حَرْثِکُم»: کشتزار خود (نگا: بقره / 71 و 205 و 223، آل‌عمران / 14). «صَارِمِینَ»: چینندگان میوه. حال است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: که اگر میوه‌چین هستید، پگاه به سراغ کشتزارتان بروید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: که بسوی کشتزار و باغ خود حرکت کنید اگر قصد چیدن میوه‌ها را دارید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: که بامداد کنید (بروید) بر کشت خود اگر هستید برندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: اگر ميوه‌چين هستيد پگاه به كشتزار خود در آييد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: که: « اگر میوه‌چین هستید بامدادان سوی کشت خویش روید.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "If you want to gather the fruits, let us go early to the plantation."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: That, “Go to your fields at early morn, if you want to harvest.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: 'Come forth betimes upon your tillage, if you would pluck!'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Saying: go out betimes to your tilth if ye would reap.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Saying: "Go to your tilth in the morning, if you would pluck the fruits."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “Go early to your plantation, if you are going to harvest.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: “Hurry to your orchard if you would gather its fruit.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Saying: "Go to your tilth in the morning, if you would pluck (the fruits)."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Saying: Run unto your field if ye would pluck (the fruit).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: ‘Get off early to your field if you have to gather [the fruits].’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'Come out to your tillage if you want to reap'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Saying], "Go early to your crop if you would cut the fruit."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: "Go early to your farms, if you want to pluck the fruits".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Saying: Go early to your tilth if you would cut (the produce).

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ani ighdoo AAala harthikum in kuntum sarimeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: saying, "Be quick to reach your orchard, if you want to gather all your fruits."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Go ye to your tilth (betimes) in the morning, if ye would gather the fruits."

verses.text: فَانْطَلَقُوا وَ هُمْ‌ يَتَخَافَتُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس به راه افتادند در حالی که آهسته به هم می گفتند:

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: به راه افتادند و آهسته مى‌گفتند:

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس به راه افتادند و آهسته به هم مى‌گفتند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس به راه افتادند و آهسته به هم مى‌گفتند

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آنها سوی بستان روان شده و آهسته سخن می‌گفتند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آنان پچ پچ کنان به راه افتادند (تا فقراء سخن ایشان را نشنوند و متوجّه آنان نشوند). [[«یَتَخَافَتُونَ»: با همدیگر آهسته صحبت می‌کردند. پچ‌پچ می‌کردند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس رهسپار شدند، در حالی که آهسته با همدیگر سخن می‌گفتند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آنها حرکت کردند در حالی که آهسته با هم می‌گفتند:»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس روی آوردند و بودند رازگویان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس به راه افتادند و با هم آهسته مى‌گفتند:

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس (خستند و) رستند درحالی که (خود را از بینوایان) بسی پنهان می‌کردند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So they departed, talking in low voices:

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So they went off, while whispering to one another.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So they departed, whispering together,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: So they went off speaking to each other in a low voice:

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So they departed, conversing in secret low tones (saying),

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So off they went, murmuring to one another.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: So off they went, whispering to one another:

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So they departed, and they were whispering:

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: So they went off, saying one unto another in low tones:

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So off they went, murmuring to one another:
