translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And so they departed, whispering to one another:

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So they set out, while lowering their voices,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They all left, whispering to one another,

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So they went, while they consulted together secretly,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faintalaqoo wahum yatakhafatoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: So they went off, whispering to one another,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So they departed, conversing in secret low tones, (saying)-

verses.text: أَنْ‌ لاَ يَدْخُلَنَّهَا الْيَوْمَ‌ عَلَيْکُمْ‌ مِسْکِينٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: امروز نباید نیازمندی در این باغ بر شما وارد شود

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: كه امروز نبايد بينوايى به بستان شما درآيد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [مواظب باشيد] كه امروز فقيرى در آن جا بر شما وارد نشود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: «كه: امروز نبايد در باغ بينوايى بر شما در آيد.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که امروز مواظب باشید فقیری در این باغ بر شما وارد نشود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: نباید امروز بینوائی در باغ پیش شما بیاید. [[«أَن لاّ یَدْخُلَنَّهَا»: مراد این است که به همدیگر توصیه می‌کردند که امروز بینوائی را به باغ راه ندهند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: که مبادا بی‌نوایی به آنجا بر شما وارد شود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: «مواظب باشید امروز حتی یک فقیر وارد بر شما نشود!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: که نبادا درآیدش امروز بر شما بینوائی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: امروز مبادا درويشى در آن

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: که: «امروز هرگز نباید در باغ، بینوایی بر (مَنظر) شما درآید.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "Let no needy person come to you within it today."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Make sure that no needy person enters your garden this day.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: 'No needy man shall enter it today against your will.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Let there not enter upon you today any needy man.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: No Miskin (poor man) shall enter upon you into it today.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “No poor person is to enter it upon you today.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: “No destitute person shall enter it today.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "No poor person shall enter upon you into it today."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: No needy man shall enter it to-day against you.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: ‘Today no needy man shall come to you in it.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'No needy person shall set foot in it today'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [Saying], "There will surely not enter it today upon you [any] poor person."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: "Let no beggar come to the garden".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Saying: No poor man shall enter it today upon you.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: An la yadkhulannaha alyawma AAalaykum miskeenun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: "Be sure to stop any poor person from entering the orchard today."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Let not a single indigent person break in upon you into the (garden) this day."

verses.text: وَ غَدَوْا عَلَى‌ حَرْدٍ قَادِرِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و بامدادان به قصد اینکه تهیدستان را محروم گذارند به سوی باغ روان شدند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: صبحگاهان بدين آهنگ كه مى‌توانند بينوا را منع كنند بيرون شدند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و به وقت صبح با قدرت بر منع [مستمندان‌] بيرون شدند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و صبحگاهان در حالى كه خود را بر منع [بينوايان‌] توانا مى‌ديدند، رفتند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و صبحدم با شوق و عزم و توانایی (بر منع فقیران) به باغ رفتند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بامدادان بدین قصد که می‌توانند (از ورود بینوایان به باغ) جلوگیری کنند و (ایشان را) باز دارند (به سوی باغ) روان شدند. [[«حَرْدٍ»: منع کردن. بازداشتن.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و بر منع و مضایقه توانا شدند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (آری) آنها صبحگاهان تصمیم داشتند که با قدرت از مستمندان جلوگیری کنند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و بامداد کردند بر بازداشتن بینوایان نیرومندان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و پگاه برفتند بدين آهنگ كه بر [چيدن و] منع درويشان توانايند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و صبحگاهان در حالی که خود را بر منع (بینوایان) توانایان و تقدیرکنان می‌دیدند، رفتند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: They left early in the morning bent on this purpose.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And they left at early morn, assuming they were in control of their purpose.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And they went forth early, determined upon their purpose.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And they went out betimes determined in purpose.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And they went in the morning with strong intention, thinking that they have power (to prevent the poor taking anything of the fruits therefrom).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And early they went, resolved in intent.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They went forth early, believing that they had the power (to gather the fruit).

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And they went in the morning with Hard Qadirin.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: They went betimes, strong in (this) purpose.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: And they set out at early morning, [considering themselves] able to deprive [the poor of its fruit].

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And they went out early, determined in their resolve.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And they went early in determination, [assuming themselves] able.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They were resolved to repel the beggars.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And in the morning they went, having the power to prevent.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waghadaw AAala hardin qadireena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They set out early in the morning, thinking they had the power to prevent.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And they opened the morning, strong in an (unjust) resolve.

verses.text: فَلَمَّا رَأَوْهَا قَالُوا إِنَّا لَضَالُّونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس چون [به باغ رسیدند و آن را نابود] دیدند، گفتند: یقیناً ما گمراه بوده ایم [که چنان تصمیم خلاف حقّی درباره مستمندان و تهیدستان گرفتیم.]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: چون بستانهاى خود را ديدند گفتند: راه را گم كرده‌ايم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس همين كه آن [باغ سوخته‌] را ديدند گفتند: محققا ما راه گم كرده‌ايم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و چون [باغ‌] را ديدند، گفتند: «قطعاً ما راه گم كرده‌ايم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: چون باغ را به آن حال دیدند با خود گفتند: (باغ ما نه اینست) ما یقین راه را گم کرده‌ایم؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: هنگامی که باغ را دیدند، گفتند: ما راه را گم کرده‌ایم! (این باغ ما نیست). [[«ضَّآلُّونَ»: راه گم کردگان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و چون آن [باغ سیاه‌سوخته‌] را دیدند [جا خوردند و] گفتند ما گم گشته‌ایم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: هنگامی که (وارد باغ شدند و) آن را دیدند گفتند: «حقّاً» ما گمراهیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: تا هنگامی که دیدندش گفتند همانا مائیم گمراهان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس چون آن را ديدند- خشك و سوخته- گفتند: هر آينه ما گمراهيم- اين باغ ما نيست-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس چون آنان را دیدند گفتند: «همواره ما همی (از) گمراهانیم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: When they saw (and did not recognise it) they said: "Surely we have lost the way.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Then when they saw it, they said, “We have indeed strayed.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: But when they saw it, they said, 'Surely we are gone astray;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then when they beheld it, they said: verily we have strayed.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: But when they saw the (garden), they said: "Verily, we have gone astray,"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But when they saw it, they said, “We were wrong.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: But as soon as they beheld the orchard, (they cried out): “We have certainly lost the way;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: But when they saw it, they said: "Verily, we have gone astray."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: But when they saw it, they said: Lo! we are in error!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: But when they saw it, they said, ‘We have indeed lost our way!’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: But when they saw it they said: 'We have surely gone astray.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But when they saw it, they said, "Indeed, we are lost;

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: When they saw the garden, they said, "Surely we have lost our way.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: But when they saw it, they said: Most surely we have gone astray

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Falamma raawha qaloo inna ladalloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: But when they saw it, they said, "We must have lost our way.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But when they saw the (garden), they said: "We have surely lost our way:

verses.text: بَلْ‌ نَحْنُ‌ مَحْرُومُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بلکه ما [از لطف خدا هم] محرومیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: نه، ما از حاصل محروم شده‌ايم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بلكه ما محروم شدگانيم [و همه چيز را از دست داده‌ايم‌]

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [نه‌] بلكه ما محروميم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: یا بلکه (باغ همان است و) ما (به قهر خدا از میوه‌اش) محروم شده‌ایم؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (بعد از اندکی تأمّل، گفتند: ما درست آمده‌ایم و راه را گم نکرده‌ایم) بلکه ما محروم (از حاصل و بهره) هستیم. (ای وای ما! ما همه چیز خود را از دست داده‌ایم!).

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: نه، مثل اینکه، بی‌بهره‌ایم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (آری، همه چیز از دست ما رفته) بلکه ما محرومیم!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بلکه مائیم بی‌بهره‌گان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [نه،] بلكه ما ناكام شده‌ايم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «(نه!) بلکه ما (از) محرومانیم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: No. In fact we have been deprived of it."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “In fact, we are unfortunate.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: nay, rather we have been robbed!'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Aye! it is we who are deprived!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (Then they said): "Nay! Indeed we are deprived of (the fruits)!"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: We are now deprived.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: rather, we are utterly ruined.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Nay! Indeed we are deprived!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Nay, but we are desolate!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: ‘No, it is we who have been deprived!’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: No, rather, we have been prevented'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Rather, we have been deprived."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (No, we are not lost.) In fact, we have been deprived of everything".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Nay! we are made to suffer privation.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Bal nahnu mahroomoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Indeed, we are utterly ruined!"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Indeed we are shut out (of the fruits of our labour)!"

verses.text: قَالَ‌ أَوْسَطُهُمْ‌ أَ لَمْ‌ أَقُلْ‌ لَکُمْ‌ لَوْ لاَ تُسَبِّحُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: عاقل ترینشان گفت: آیا به شما نگفتم که چرا خدا را [به پاک بودن از هر عیب و نقصی] یاد نمی کنید [و چرا او را از انتقام گرفتن درمانده می دانید؟!]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: نيكمردشان گفت: شما را نگفتم؛ چرا خدا را تسبيح نمى‌گوييد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: عاقل‌ترشان گفت: آيا به شما نگفتم: چرا [خدا را] تسبيح نمى‌گوييد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: خردمندترينشان گفت: «آيا به شما نگفتم: چرا خدا را به پاكى نمى‌ستاييد؟»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: یک نفر بهترین اولاد و عادلترین‌شان به آنها گفت: من به شما نگفتم چرا (شکر نعمت و) تسبیح و ستایش خدا را بجا نیاورید؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: نیکمردترین ایشان گفت: مگر من به شما نگفتم: چرا نباید به تسبیح و تقدیس خدا بپردازید؟! [[«أَوْسَطُهُمْ»: بهترین ایشان از نظر عقل و دین (نگا: بقره / 143). «لَوْ لا»: (نگا: کهف / 39). سخنان این نیکمرد جنبه سرزنش دارد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بهترینشان گفت مگر به شما نگفته بودم که چرا تسبیح [و ان شاء الله‌] نمی‌گویید؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: یکی از آنها که از همه عاقلتر بود گفت: «آیا به شما نگفتم چرا تسبیح خدا نمی‌گویید؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفت میانی ایشان آیا نگفتم به شما چرا تسبیح نکنید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: بهترينشان- به خِرَد و ميانه‌روى- گفت: آيا شما را نگفتم: چرا خداى را به پاكى ياد نمى‌كنيد؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: میانه‌روتر‌شان گفت: «آیا به شما نگفتم (چرا خدا را) به پاکی نمی‌ستایید؟»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: One who was temperate among them, said: "Did I not say: 'Why don't you priase God?'"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: The best among them said, “Did I not tell you, ‘Why do you not proclaim His purity?’”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Said the most moderate of them, 'Did I not say to you, "Why do you not give glory?"'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: The most moderate of them said: said I not Unto you, wherefore hallow him ye not!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: The best among them said: "Did I not tell you: why do you not say: Insha' Allah (If Allah will)."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: The most reasonable of them said, “Did I not say to you, ‘if only you would glorify?’”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: The best among them said: “Did I not say to you: why do you not give glory to (your Lord)?”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: The Awsat among them said; "Did I not tell you, `Why do you not Tusabbihun."'

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: The best among them said: Said I not unto you: Why glorify ye not (Allah)?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: The most upright among them said, ‘Did I not tell you, ‘‘Why do you not glorify [Allah]?’’ ’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: (Whereupon) the best among them said: 'Did I not say to you to exalt (Allah)'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: The most moderate of them said, "Did I not say to you, 'Why do you not exalt [Allah]?' "

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: A reasonable one among them said, "Did I not tell you that you should glorify God?"

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: The best of them said: Did I not say to you, Why do you not glorify (Allah)?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qala awsatuhum alam aqul lakum lawla tusabbihoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: The more upright of the two said, "Did I not bid you to glorify God?"

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Said one of them, more just (than the rest): "Did I not say to you, 'Why not glorify (Allah)?'"

verses.text: قَالُوا سُبْحَانَ‌ رَبِّنَا إِنَّا کُنَّا ظَالِمِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گفتند: پروردگارا! تو را به پاکی می ستاییم، مسلماً ما ستمکار بوده ایم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفتند: منزه است پروردگار ما، ما ستمكار بوديم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفتند: پروردگار ما منزه است، ما واقعا ستمگر بوده‌ايم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفتند: «پروردگارا، تو را به پاكى مى‌ستاييم، ما واقعاً ستمگر بوديم. «

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آنان همه گفتند: خدای ما (از ظلم) منزّه است، آری ما خود (در حق خویش) ستم کردیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: گفتند: پروردگارمان پاک و منزّه است (از این که به کسی ستم کند). قطعاً ما (با انجام گناهان و ترک عبادات و خیرات، به خود) ستم کرده‌ایم. [[«إِنَّا کُنَّا ظَالِمِینَ»: (نگا: اعراف / 5، انبیاء / 46).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گفتند پاک است پروردگارمان، ما خود ستمکار بودیم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: گفتند: «منزّه است پروردگار ما، مسلّماً ما ظالم بودیم!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفتند منزّه است پروردگار ما همانا بودیم ما ستمگران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفتند: پاك است پروردگار ما، همانا ما ستمكار بوده‌ايم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفتند: «پروردگارمان! تو را به پاکی می‌ستاییم‌. ما همانا ستمگران بوده‌ایم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: "Glory to our Lord," they said; we were really in the wrong."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They said, “Purity is to our Lord – we have indeed been unjust.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They said, 'Glory be to God, our Lord; truly, we were evildoers.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They said: hallowed be Our Lord! verily we have been wrong- doers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They said: "Glory to Our Lord! Verily, we have been Zalimun (wrong-doers, etc.)."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They said, “Glory to our Lord—We were indeed in the wrong.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They cried out: “Glory be to our Lord! Certainly we were sinners.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They said: "Glory to Our Lord! Verily, we have been wrongdoers."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: They said: Glorified be our Lord! Lo! we have been wrong-doers.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They said, ‘Immaculate is our Lord! We have indeed been wrongdoers!’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: 'Exaltations to Allah, our Lord' they said, 'We were truly harmdoers'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: They said, "Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They said, "All glory belongs to God. We have certainly been unjust".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: They said: Glory be to our Lord, surely we were unjust.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qaloo subhana rabbina inna kunna thalimeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They said, "Glory be to God, our Lord. We have surely done wrong."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They said: "Glory to our Lord! Verily we have been doing wrong!"

verses.text: فَأَقْبَلَ‌ بَعْضُهُمْ‌ عَلَى‌ بَعْضٍ‌ يَتَلاَوَمُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس به یکدیگر رو کرده به سرزنش و ملامت هم پرداختند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس زبان به ملامت يكديگر گشودند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس بعضى بر بعضى روى كرده يكديگر را ملامت مى‌كردند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس بعضى‌شان رو به بعضى ديگر آوردند و همديگر را به نكوهش گرفتند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و رو به یکدیگر کرده به ملامت و نکوهش هم پرداختند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پس به همدیگر رو کردند و زبان به سرزنش یکدیگر گشودند. [[«أَقْبَلَ»: رو کرد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس به سرزنش به همدیگر روی آوردند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: سپس رو به یکدیگر کرده به ملامت هم پرداختند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس روی آوردند برخیشان به برخی نکوهش‌کنان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس برخى از ايشان بر برخ ديگر سرزنش‌كنان روى آورده،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس بعضیشان رو به بعضی دیگر آوردند، در حالی که همدیگر را به نکوهش گرفتند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then they started blaming one another,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So they came towards each other, blaming.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And they advanced one upon another, blaming each other.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then they turned to each other reproaching

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then they turned, one against another, in blaming.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then they turned to one another, blaming one another.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Then they began to reproach one another.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then they turned one against another, blaming.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then some of them drew near unto others, self-reproaching.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then they turned to one another, blaming each other.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And they came blaming one another.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then they approached one another, blaming each other.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Some of them started to blame others.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then some of them advanced against others, blaming each other.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faaqbala baAAduhum AAala baAAdin yatalawamoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Then they began to heap reproaches on each other.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then they turned, one against another, in reproach.

verses.text: قَالُوا يَا وَيْلَنَا إِنَّا کُنَّا طَاغِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: گفتند: وای بر ما که طغیان گر بوده ایم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: گفتند: واى بر ما، ما مردمى سركش بوده‌ايم،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گفتند: اى واى بر ما! در حقيقت ما سركش بوده‌ايم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: گفتند: «اى واى بر ما كه سركش بوده‌ايم

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: گفتند: ای وای بر ما که سخت سرکش بودیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: گفتند: وای بر ما! ما مردمان نافرمان و سرکشی بوده‌ایم (و زیر بار قانون خدا نرفته‌ایم، و به وظائف انسانی خود عمل نکرده‌ایم!). [[«یَا وَیْلَنَا!»: وای بر ما! (نگا: انبیاء / 46 و 97، یس / 52، صافّات / 20).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گفتند وای بر ما، ما سرکش بوده‌ایم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (و فریادشان بلند شد) گفتند: «وای بر ما که طغیانگر بودیم!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: گفتند وای بر ما همانا بودیم ما سرکشان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: گفتند: واى بر ما، همانا ما سركش بوده‌ايم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: گفتند: «ای وای برما که همواره سرکش بوده‌ایم!»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Saying: "Alas the woe, we were iniquitous.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: They said, “Woe to us – we were indeed rebellious.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: They said, 'Woe, alas for us! Truly, we were insolent.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: They said: woe Unto us! verily we! we have been arrogant.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: They said: "Woe to us! Verily, we were Taghun (transgressors and disobedient, etc.)

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: They said, “Woe to us—we were indeed domineering.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: They said: “Woe to us! We had indeed transgressed.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: They said: "Woe to us! Verily, we were Taghin."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: They said: Alas for us! In truth we were outrageous.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: They said, ‘Woe to us! Indeed, we have been rebellious.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: They said 'Woe to us, truly we were insolent'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: They said, "O woe to us; indeed we were transgressors.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: They said, "Woe to us. We have been arrogant.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Said they: O woe to us! surely we were inordinate:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Qaloo ya waylana inna kunna tagheena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: They said, "Alas for us, our behaviour was beyond the pale.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: They said: "Alas for us! We have indeed transgressed!

verses.text: عَسَى‌ رَبُّنَا أَنْ‌ يُبْدِلَنَا خَيْراً مِنْهَا إِنَّا إِلَى‌ رَبِّنَا رَاغِبُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: امید است پروردگارمان بهتر از آن را به ما عوض دهد چون ما [از هر چیزی دل بریدیم و] به پروردگارمان راغب و علاقه مندیم.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: باشد كه پروردگار ما در عوض، چيزى بهتر از آن ما را ارزانى دارد. ما به پروردگار خود روى آورده‌ايم.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: اميد است كه پروردگارمان بهتر از آن را به ما عوض دهد، [زيرا] ما به پروردگارمان روى آورده‌ايم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: اميد است كه پروردگار ما بهتر از آن را به ما عوض دهد، زيرا ما به پروردگارمان مشتاقيم.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: اینک امیدواریم که پروردگار ما به جای آن، بستان بهتری به ما عطا کند، که (از این پس) ما همیشه به خدای خود مشتاقیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: امیدواریم پروردگارمان (باغی) بهتر از این باغ را به ما ارزانی دارد. ما (در کارهای خود تجدید نظر نموده‌ایم و از اعمال بد خویش دست کشیده‌ایم و) رو به سوی پروردگارمان کرده‌ایم. [[«یُبْدِ لَنَا»: به ما عوض دهد. «رَاغِبُونَ»: مشتاقان، علاقه‌مندان، گرایندگان.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: چه بسا پروردگارمان بهتر از آن را برایمان جانشین گرداند، ما به سوی پروردگارمان می‌گراییم‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: امیدواریم پروردگارمان (ما را ببخشد و) بهتر از آن به جای آن به ما بدهد، چرا که ما به او علاقه‌مندیم!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: امید است پروردگار ما تبدیل کند ما را به از این که مائیم بسوی پروردگار خویش گرایندگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: اميد است پروردگار ما بهتر از آن را به ما باز دهد، ما به پروردگارمان گراينده‌ايم.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «امید است که پروردگارمان بهتر از آن را به ما عوض دهد. ما به‌راستی سوی پروردگارمان مشتاقانیم.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Maybe our Lord will give us better than this. We turn to our Lord in supplication."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “Hopefully, our Lord will give us a better replacement than this – we now incline towards our Lord.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: It may be that our Lord will give us in exchange a better than it; to our Lord we humbly turn.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Belike our Lord may exchange for us better garden than this; verily we are Unto our Lord beseechers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: We hope that our Lord will give us in exchange a better (garden) than this. Truly, we turn to our Lord (wishing for good that He may forgive our sins, and reward us in the Hereafter)."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Perhaps our Lord will give us a better substitute for it. We are turning to our Lord.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Maybe our Lord will give us a better orchard in its place; to our Lord do we penitently turn.”

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "We hope that our Lord will give us in exchange better than it. Truly, we hope in our Lord."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: It may be that our Lord will give us better than this in place thereof. Lo! we beseech our Lord.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Maybe our Lord will give us a better one in its place. Indeed we earnestly beseech our Lord.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: It may be that our Lord will give us better than it in exchange. To our Lord we humbly turn'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Perhaps our Lord will substitute for us [one] better than it. Indeed, we are toward our Lord desirous."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Perhaps our Lord will replace it with a better garden. We turn in repentance to our Lord".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Maybe, our Lord will give us instead one better than it; surely to our Lord do we make our humble petition.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: AAasa rabbuna an yubdilana khayran minha inna ila rabbina raghiboona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: May be our Lord will give us a better orchard in its stead; we turn to Him."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "It may be that our Lord will give us in exchange a better (garden) than this: for we do turn to Him (in repentance)!"

verses.text: کَذٰلِکَ‌ الْعَذَابُ‌ وَ لَعَذَابُ‌ الْآخِرَةِ أَکْبَرُ لَوْ کَانُوا يَعْلَمُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: چنین است عذاب [دنیا] و عذاب آخرت اگر معرفت و آگاهی داشتند، بزرگ تر است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اينچنين است عذاب. و اگر بدانند، عذاب آخرت بزرگ‌تر است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: عذاب [دنيا] چنين است، و عذاب آخرت قطعا بزرگ‌تر است اگر مى‌دانستند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: عذاب [دنيا] چنين است، و عذاب آخرت، اگر مى‌دانستند قطعاً بزرگتر خواهد بود.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: این گونه است عذاب (دنیا) و البته عذاب آخرت بسیار سخت‌تر است اگر مردم بدانند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: عذاب (دنیوی خدا) این گونه است، و قطعاً عذاب آخرت سخت‌تر و بزرگتر (از این عذابهای دنیوی) است، اگر مردم متوجّه بوده و بدانند. [[«کَذلِکَ الْعَذَابُ»: عذاب این گونه است که می‌بینید. عذاب این چنین باید باشد.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: این چنین است عذاب، و اگر می‌دانستند عذاب اخروی سهمگین‌تر است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: این گونه است عذاب (خداوند در دنیا)، و عذاب آخرت از آن هم بزرگتر است اگر می‌دانستند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: چنین است عذاب همانا عذاب آخرت است بزرگتر اگر باشند بدانند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: چنين است عذاب [اين جهانى‌]، و هر آينه عذاب آن جهان بزرگتر است، اگر مى‌دانستند.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: عذاب (دنیا) چنان است، و عذاب آخرت - اگر می‌دانستند- بی‌چون بزرگتر است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Such is Our chastisement; and the punishment of the Hereafter will be greater, if only they knew!

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Such is the punishment; and indeed the punishment of the Hereafter is the greatest, if only they knew!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Such is the chastisement; and the chastisement of the world to come, is assuredly greater, did they but know.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Such is the torment. And the torment of the Hereafter is far greater; if they but knew.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Such is the punishment (in this life), but truly, the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they but knew.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Such is the punishment; but the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Such is the chastisement; and the chastisement of the Hereafter is assuredly even greater, if only they knew.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Such is the punishment, but truly, the punishment of the Hereafter is greater if they but knew.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Such was the punishment. And verily the punishment of the Hereafter is greater if they did but know.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Such was their punishment; and the punishment of the Hereafter is surely greater, had they known.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Such was their punishment. But the punishment of the Everlasting Life is much greater, if they but knew.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Such is the punishment [of this world]. And the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Such is the torment if only they knew that the torment in the life hereafter will certainly be greater.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Such is the chastisement, and certainly the chastisement of the hereafter is greater, did they but know!

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Kathalika alAAathabu walaAAathabu alakhirati akbaru law kanoo yaAAlamoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Such was their punishment, [in this life]. But the punishment of the life to come is much more severe, if only they knew it!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Such is the Punishment (in this life); but greater is the Punishment in the Hereafter,- if only they knew!

verses.text: إِنَ‌ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ‌ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِمْ‌ جَنَّاتِ‌ النَّعِيمِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بی تردید برای پرهیزکاران نزد پروردگارشان بهشت های پرنعمت است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: براى پرهيزگاران در نزد پروردگارشان بستانهايى است پرنعمت.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: همانا براى پرهيزكاران نزد پروردگارشان بهشت‌هاى پرناز و نعمت است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: براى پرهيزگاران، نزد پروردگارشان باغستانهاى پر ناز و نعمت است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (در آخرت) برای متقیان نزد پروردگارشان باغهای بهشت پرنعمت خواهد بود.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پرهیزگاران در نزد پروردگار خود، باغهای پر نعمت بهشت را دارند. [[«جَنَّاتِ النَّعِیمِ»: (نگا: مائده / 65، یونس / 9، حجّ / 56).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: برای پرهیزگاران در نزد پروردگارشان بهشتهای پرناز و نعمت است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: مسلّماً برای پرهیزگاران نزد پروردگارشان باغهای پر نعمت بهشت است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا پرهیزکاران را است نزد پروردگار ایشان بهشتهای نعمتها

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: همانا پرهيزگاران را نزد پروردگارشان بهشتهاى پرنعمت است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بی‌گمان برای پرهیزگاران، نزد پروردگارشان باغستان‌های پرناز و نعمت است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: For those who fear God there are pleasure gardens with their Lord.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Indeed for the pious, with their Lord, are Gardens of Serenity.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Surely for the godfearing shall be Gardens of Bliss with their Lord.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Verily for the God-fearing, are with their Lord Gardens of Delight.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Verily, for the Muttaqun (pious and righteous persons - see V. 2:2) are Gardens of delight (Paradise) with their Lord.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: For the righteous are Gardens of Delight with their Lord.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Surely the God-fearing shall have Gardens of bliss with their Lord.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Verily, for those who have Taqwa are Gardens of Delight with their Lord.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Lo! for those who keep from evil are gardens of bliss with their Lord.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed for the Godwary there will be gardens of bliss near their Lord.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Surely, the cautious shall have Gardens of Bliss with their Lord.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Indeed, for the righteous with their Lord are the Gardens of Pleasure.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The pious ones will receive a beautiful Paradise from their Lord.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Surely those who guard (against evil) shall have with their Lord gardens of bliss.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna lilmuttaqeena AAinda rabbihim jannati alnnaAAeemi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Those who are mindful of their Lord will be rewarded with gardens of bliss.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Verily, for the Righteous, are Gardens of Delight, in the Presence of their Lord.

verses.text: أَ فَنَجْعَلُ‌ الْمُسْلِمِينَ‌ کَالْمُجْرِمِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا ما تسلیم شدگان [به فرمان ها و احکام خود] را چون مجرمان قرار می دهیم؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا با تسليم‌شدگان چون مجرمان رفتار مى‌كنيم؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس آيا ما مطيعان را چون بدكاران قرار مى‌دهيم

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس آيا فرمانبرداران را چون بدكاران قرار خواهيم داد؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا هرگز اهل اسلام را با کافران بدکار یکسان قرار می‌دهیم؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا فرمانبرداران را همچون گناهکاران یکسان می‌شماریم؟! [[«الْمُسْلِمِینَ»: فرمانبرداران. تسلیم شوندگان فرمان یزدان (نگا: انعام / 163، اعراف / 126، یونس / 72).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا مسلمانان را همانند گناهکاران می‌شماریم؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا مؤمنان را همچون مجرمان قرار می‌دهیم؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا گردانیم مسلمانان را چون گنهکاران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس آيا مسلمانان- گردن‌نهادگان- را همچون بزهكاران مى‌سازيم- يكسان و برابر-؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس آیا فرمانبرداران را چون مجرمان و (نافرمانان) قرار خواهیم داد؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Should We treat those who submit and obey in the same way as those who are culpable?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Shall We equate the Muslims to the guilty?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: What, shall we make those who have surrendered like to the sinners?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Shall We then make the Muslims like the culprits?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Shall We then treat the (submitting) Muslims like the Mujrimun (criminals, polytheists and disbelievers, etc.)?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Shall We treat the Muslims like the villains?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: What! Shall We treat those who have submitted (to Our command) like those who have acted as criminals?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Shall We then treat the Muslims like the criminals

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Shall We then treat those who have surrendered as We treat the guilty?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Shall We treat those who submit [to Us] as [We treat] the guilty?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: What, shall We make those who are submissive like the wrongdoers?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then will We treat the Muslims like the criminals?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Shall We treat the Muslims like criminals?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: What! shall We then make (that is, treat) those who submit as the guilty?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: AfanajAAalu almuslimeena kaalmujrimeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Should We treat the true believers and the wrongdoers alike?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Shall We then treat the People of Faith like the People of Sin?

verses.text: مَا لَکُمْ‌ کَيْفَ‌ تَحْکُمُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: شما را چه شده؟ چگونه داوری می کنید؟!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: شما را چه مى‌شود؟ چسان داورى مى‌كنيد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: شما را چه شده است؟ چگونه داورى مى‌كنيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: شما را چه شده؟ چگونه داورى مى‌كنيد؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: شما را چیست؟ چگونه شما (این چنین) حکم (ظالمانه) می‌کنید؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: شما را چه می‌شود؟! چگونه داوری می‌کنید؟! [[«مَا لَکُمْ»: به شما چه رسیده است؟ چه چیزتان می‌شود؟ «کَیْفَ»: مراد از استفهام، تعجّب از داوری نادرست کافران است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: شما را چه می‌شود چگونه داوری می‌کنید؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: شما را چه می‌شود؟! چگونه داوری می‌کنید؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: چه شود شما را چگونه حکم کنید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: شما را چيست؟! چگونه داورى مى‌كنيد؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: شما را چه شده‌؟ چگونه داوری می‌کنید؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: What has come upon you that you judge in such a wise?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: What is the matter with you? What sort of a judgement you impose!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: What ails you then, how you judge?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: What aileth you? How ill ye judge!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: What is the matter with you? How judge you?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: What is the matter with you? How do you judge?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: What is the matter with you? How ill do you judge!

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: What is the matter with you How judge you

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: What aileth you? How foolishly ye judge!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: What is the matter with you? How do you judge!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: What is the matter with you then, how do you judge?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: What is [the matter] with you? How do you judge?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: What is the matter with you? How could you judge this to be so?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: What has happened to you? How do you judge?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ma lakum kayfa tahkumoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: What ails you? How ill you judge!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: What is the matter with you? How judge ye?

verses.text: أَمْ‌ لَکُمْ‌ کِتَابٌ‌ فِيهِ‌ تَدْرُسُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا شما را کتابی [آسمانی از نزد خدا] ست که در آن می خوانید

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا شما را كتابى است كه از آن مى‌خوانيد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا شما را كتابى است كه [اين حكم را] در آن مى‌خوانيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: يا شما را كتابى هست كه در آن فرا مى‌گيريد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا شما را کتابی است (آسمانی) که در آن این حکم می‌خوانید؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا شما کتابی (از جانب خدا) دارید که از روی آن (قوانین خدا را) می‌خوانید (و برابر آن حکم صادر می‌کنید؟). [[«کِتَابٌ»: مراد کتاب آسمانی است (نگا: سبأ / 44). «تَدْرُسُون»: روخوانی می‌کنید (نگا: آل‌عمران / 79، انعام / 105، اعراف / 169).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا مگر کتابی دارید که در آنها مطالعه می‌کنید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا کتابی دارید که از آن درس می‌خوانید...

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: یا شما را است کتابی که در آن درس خوانید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: يا مگر شما را كتابى است كه در آن مى‌خوانيد،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا شما را کتابی (وحیانی) است که در آن (وحی) فرا می‌گیرید،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Or have you a Book in which you read

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Is there a Book for you, from which you read?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Or have you a Book wherein you study?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Is there with you a Book wherein ye study:

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Or have you a Book through which you learn.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or do you have a scripture in which you study.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Or do you have a Book wherein you read

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Or have you a Book wherein you learn,

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or have ye a scripture wherein ye learn

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Do you possess a scripture in which you read

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Or, have you a Book from which you study

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or do you have a scripture in which you learn

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do you have a book from which you study

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or have you a book wherein you read,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Am lakum kitabun feehi tadrusoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Have you a Scripture that tells you

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Or have ye a book through which ye learn-

verses.text: إِنَ‌ لَکُمْ‌ فِيهِ‌ لَمَا تَخَيَّرُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: که در آن جهان هر چه را شما بخواهید و انتخاب کنید برای شما خواهد بود؟!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و هر چه اختيار كنيد در آن هست؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: كه هر چه را شما انتخاب كنيد از آن شماست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: كه هر چه را برمى‌گزينيد، براى شما در آن خواهد بود؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که هر آنچه به هوای نفس بخواهید شما را فراهم است؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و شما آنچه را که بر می‌گزینید (و برابر آن داوری می‌کنید) در آن است؟ [[«فِیهِ»: در آن کتاب. «مَا تَخَیَّرُونَ»: چیزی را که بر می‌گزینید. هر چه که می‌خواهید. معنی دیگر آیه: آنچه را که بخواهید، در آن هست.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: که در آن برای شما هرچه آرزو کنید هست؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: که آنچه را شما انتخاب می‌کنید از آن شماست؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا شما را است در آن آنچه برگزینید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: كه شما راست در آن [جهان‌] هر چه گزينيد؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: که هرچه را برمی‌گزینید، بی‌گمان برای شما در آن (کتاب) خواهد بود؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: That you can surely have whatever you choose?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: - That for you in it is whatever you like?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Surely therein you shall have whatever you choose!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: That therein is yours that which. ye may choose?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: That you shall have all that you choose?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Wherein there is whatever you choose?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: that (in the Hereafter) you shall have all that you choose for yourselves?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: That you shall therein have all that you choose

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: That ye shall indeed have all that ye choose?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: that you shall have in it whatever you choose?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: surely in it you shall have whatever you choose!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: That indeed for you is whatever you choose?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: that tells you to do whatever you want?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: That you have surely therein what you choose?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Inna lakum feehi lama takhayyaroona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: that you will be granted whatever you choose?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: That ye shall have, through it whatever ye choose?

verses.text: أَمْ‌ لَکُمْ‌ أَيْمَانٌ‌ عَلَيْنَا بَالِغَةٌ إِلَى‌ يَوْمِ‌ الْقِيَامَةِ إِنَ‌ لَکُمْ‌ لَمَا تَحْکُمُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: یا شما را بر ما تا روز قیامت پیمان و سوگند استواری است که هر چه را به سود خود حکم کنید ویژه شماست؟!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: يا با ما پيمانى كه به روز قيامت كشد بسته‌ايد؛ كه به هر چه حكم كنيد حق شما باشد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا شما را تا روز قيامت بر عهده‌ى ما پيمان‌هاى مؤكدى است كه هر چه شما حكم كنيد حق شما باشد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: يا اينكه شما تا روز قيامت [از ما] سوگندهايى رسا گرفته‌ايد كه هر چه دلتان خواست حكم كنيد؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: یا شما را بر ما (به عدم عقاب) عهد و سوگند دائمی تا روز قیامت است که هر چه حکم فرمایید به یقین بر شما فراهم است؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: یا با ما پیمانهائی بسته‌اید که تا روز قیامت به هر چه حکم کنید حق شما باشد؟ [[«أَیْمَانٌ»: جمع یَمین، پیمانها و عهدها.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا شما را پیمانهایی است با ما که حکم آن تا قیامت باقی باشد که هر چه حکم کنید برای شما باشد؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: یا اینکه عهد و پیمان مؤکّد و مستمرّی تا روز قیامت بر ما دارید که هر چه را حکم کنید برای شما باشد؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: یا شما را است بر ما سوگندهائی رسنده به روز قیامت که شما را است آنچه فرمان دهید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: يا مگر شما را بر ما پيمانهايى است رسا و پيوسته تا روز رستاخيز، كه هر چه حكم كنيد شما را باشد؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا اینکه شما تا روز قیامت (از ما) سوگندهایی رسا گرفته‌اید که هر چه دلتان خواست همواره (به آن) حکم کنید؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Or have you taken a binding promise from Us which would hold till the Day of Judgement, that you will get whatever you demand?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Or is it that you have a covenant from Us, right up to the Day of Judgement, that you will get all what you claim?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Or have you oaths from Us, reaching to the Day of Resurrection? Surely you shall have whatever you judge!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Or have ye oaths from us reaching to the Day of Resurrection, that you shall be that which ye judge?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Or you have oaths from Us, reaching to the Day of Resurrection that yours will be what you judge.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or do you have oaths from Us, binding until the Day of Resurrection, that you will have whatever you demand?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Or have We sworn a covenant with you which We are bound to keep till the Day of Resurrection, (a covenant requiring that whatever you ordain for yourselves shall be yours)?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Or have you oaths from Us, lasting until the Day of Judgement, that yours will be what you judge

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or have ye a covenant on oath from Us that reacheth to the Day of Judgment, that yours shall be all that ye ordain?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Do you have a pledge binding on Us until the Day of Resurrection, that you shall indeed have whatever you decide?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Or, have you an oath from Us that stretches to the Day of Resurrection (if so) you shall surely have what you judge!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or do you have oaths [binding] upon Us, extending until the Day of Resurrection, that indeed for you is whatever you judge?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do you have a covenant with Us which allows you to do whatever you want until the Day of Judgment?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or have you received from Us an agreement confirmed by an oath extending to the day of resurrection that you shall surely have what you demand?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Am lakum aymanun AAalayna balighatun ila yawmi alqiyamati inna lakum lama tahkumoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Or do you have Our solemn oaths, binding upon Us till the Day of Resurrection, that you shall have whatever you yourselves decide?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Or have ye Covenants with Us to oath, reaching to the Day of Judgment, (providing) that ye shall have whatever ye shall demand?

verses.text: سَلْهُمْ‌ أَيُّهُمْ‌ بِذٰلِکَ‌ زَعِيمٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: از آنان بپرس کدامشان ضامن آن ادعاست [که مسلمان و مجرم یکسانند؟!!]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: از ايشان بپرس كدام يكشان ضامن چنين پيمانى است؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: از آنها بپرس: كدامشان ضامن اين [ادعا] يند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: از آنان بپرس: كدامشان ضامن اين [ادعا] يند؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: از آنان بپرس تا کدام ضامن این پیمانند؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: از آنان بپرس، کدام یک از ایشان، ضامن چنین پیمانهائی است. [[«زَعِیمٌ»: ضامن. عهده‌دار (نگا: یوسف / 72).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: از ایشان بپرس که کدامیک از آنان ضامن این امر است؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: از آنها بپرس کدام یک از آنان چنین چیزی را تضمین می‌کند؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بپرسشان کدامین از ایشان است بدان گروندگان (یا پندارنده)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: از آنها بپرس كه كدامشان ضامن اين [دعوى‌] اند

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: از آنان بپرس کدامشان بدین گمان است؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Ask them: "Which of you is able to vouch for this?"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Ask them, who among them is a guarantor for it?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Ask them, which of them will guarantee that!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Ask then, which of them will stand thereof a surety?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Ask them, which of them will stand surety for that!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Ask them, which of them will guarantee that.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Ask them: “Which of them can guarantee that?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Ask them, which of them will stand as surety for that!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Ask them (O Muhammad) which of them will vouch for that!

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Ask them, which of them will aver [any of] that!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Ask them, which of them will guarantee that!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Ask them which of them, for that [claim], is responsible.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), ask which of them can guarantee that on the Day of Judgment.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Ask them which of them will vouch for that,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Salhum ayyuhum bithalika zaAAeemun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Ask them, which of them will vouch for that!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Ask thou of them, which of them will stand surety for that!

verses.text: أَمْ‌ لَهُمْ‌ شُرَکَاءُ فَلْيَأْتُوا بِشُرَکَائِهِمْ‌ إِنْ‌ کَانُوا صَادِقِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: یا شریکانی [در ربوبیت خدا] دارند [که از آنان نزد خدا شفاعت کنند که در اجر و ثواب با مسلمانان یکسان شوند؟] پس اگر راستگویند، شریکانشان را [به میدان] آورند.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: يا آنها را بتانى است؟ اگر راست مى‌گويند بتان خود را بياورند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا شريكانى دارند؟ پس بايد شريكان خود را بياورند اگر راست مى‌گويند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: يا شريكانى دارند؟ پس اگر راست مى‌گويند شريكانشان را بياورند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: یا آنها گواهانی (بر دعوی خود) دارند؟ اگر راست می‌گویند آن گواهان را حاضر کنند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: یا این که شریکهائی دارند (که همچون ایشان می‌اندیشند، و سردستگان و خطّ دهندگان ایشان بوده و از آنان حمایت و جانبداری می‌کنند؟). اگر راست می‌گویند، شرکاء (و رؤساء) خود را بیاورند (تا شهادت بر ضمانت خود را بدهند و بگویند که از مشرکان در محضر یزدان دفاع و حمایت خواهند کرد). [[«شُرَکَآءُ»: مراد اربابان همرأی و هم اندیشه مشرکان، یا معبودهای دروغین و بتهای بی‌جان ایشان، و یا این که گواهان است. به هر حال برای اثبات ادّعای پوچ و نادرستشان، از ایشان خواسته شده است: با دلیلی از عقل، یا کتابی از کتابهای آسمانی، یا عهد و پیمانی از خداوند، و یا انبازان و گواهان و اربابان و معبودهای خود را بیاورند تا سخنانشان را تصدیق کنند و ضمانتشان را بکنند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا شرکایی دارند، پس اگر راست می‌گویند شریکانشان را به میان آورند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: یا اینکه معبودانی دارند که آنها را شریک خدا قرار داده‌اند (و برای آنان شفاعت می‌کنند)؟! اگر راست می‌گویند معبودان خود را بیاورند!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: یا ایشان را است شریکانی پس بیارند شریکان خویش را اگر هستند راستگویان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: يا مگر ايشان را انبازانى است- بتها و معبودانى جز خدا كه پشتيبان آنها باشند-؟! پس اگر راستگويند انبازان خويش بيارند،

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا برایشان شریکانی است‌؟ پس اگر راست می‌گویند شریکانشان را بیاورند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Or have they any partners? Let them bring their partners then, if what they say is true.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Or is it that they have partners in worship? So they should bring their appointed partners, if they are truthful.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Or do they have associates? Then let them bring their associates, if they speak truly.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Have they associate gods? Then let them produce their associate gods if they say sooth!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Or have they "partners"? Then let them bring their "partners" if they are truthful!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or do they have partners? Then let them produce their partners, if they are truthful.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Or has something been guaranteed by any of those whom they associate with Allah in His Divinity?” If so, let them bring forth their associates, if they are truthful.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Or have they "partners" Then let them bring their "partners" if they are truthful!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or have they other gods? Then let them bring their other gods if they are truthful

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Do they have any ‘partners’ [that they claim for Allah]? Then let them produce their partners, if they are truthful.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Or, do they have associates? Then let them bring their associates, if what they say is true!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or do they have partners? Then let them bring their partners, if they should be truthful.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: they will receive the same thing that the Muslims will? Do they have any witness to such an agreement? Let them bring out such witness, if they are truthful.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or have they associates if they are truthful.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Am lahum shurakao falyatoo bishurakaihim in kanoo sadiqeena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Or have they other partners [besides God]? Let them bring forth their other partners, if what they say be true.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Or have they some "Partners" (in Allahhead)? Then let them produce their "partners", if they are truthful!

verses.text: يَوْمَ‌ يُکْشَفُ‌ عَنْ‌ سَاقٍ‌ وَ يُدْعَوْنَ‌ إِلَى‌ السُّجُودِ فَلاَ يَسْتَطِيعُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [یاد کن] روزی را که کار بر آنان به شدت سخت و دشوار شود، [و آن روز که جای هیچ تکلیف و عبادتی نیست به عنوان سرزنش و ملامت] به سجده کردن دعوت شوند، ولی در خود قدرت و استطاعت [سجده کردن] نیابند!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: روزى كه آن واقعه عظيم پديدار شود و آنها را به سجود فرا خوانند، ولى نتوانند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: روزى كه كار [بر كافران‌] سخت و دشوار شود و آنها [به تمسخر] به سجده فرا خوانده شوند ولى نتوانند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: روزى كه كار، زار [و رهايى دشوار] شود و به سجده فرا خوانده شوند و در خود توانايى نيابند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: در آن روز بسیار سخت به سجده خدا خوانده شوند و نتوانند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: روزی، هول و هراس به اوج خود می‌رسد، و کار سخت دشوار می‌شود. بدین هنگام از کافران و مشرکان خواسته می‌شود که سجده کنند و کرنش ببرند، امّا ایشان نمی‌توانند چنین کنند. [[«یَوْمَ»: مراد روز قیامت است. «یُکْشَفُ عَن سَاقٍ»: پاچه‌ها بالا زده می‌شود. در فارسی گفته می‌شود: دامن به کمر زده می‌شود. کنایه از فرا رسیدن هنگامه هول و هراس و وخامت کار و شدّت و وحشت است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: روزی که هنگامه بالا گیرد، و آنان را به سجده دعوت کنند ولی نتوانند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (به خاطر بیاورید) روزی را که ساق پاها (از وحشت) برهنه می‌گردد و دعوت به سجود می‌شوند، امّا نمی‌توانند (سجود کنند).

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: روزی که گشوده شود از ساق (پرده از روی کار برداشته شود) و دعوت شوند به سجده‌کردن پس نتوانند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: در روزى كه كار [بر كافران‌] سخت و دشوار شود، و آنان به سجود خوانده شوند ولى نتوانند

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: روزی که از ساق (و سوق اعمالشان) پرده برگرفته شود به سجده فراخوانده شوند، پس نتوانند (سجده کنند).

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: On the day the great calamity befalls, and they are called to bow in homage, they will not be able to do so.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: On the day when the Shin* will be exposed and they will be called to prostrate themselves, they will be unable. (Used as a metaphor)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Upon the day when the leg shall be bared, and they shall be summoned to bow themselves, but they cannot;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Remember the Day whereon the shank shall be bared and they shall be called upon to Prostrate themselves, but they shall not be able.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: (Remember) the Day when the Shin shall be laid bare (i.e. the Day of Resurrection) and they shall be called to prostrate (to Allah), but they (hypocrites) shall not be able to do so,

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: On the Day when the Shin will be exposed, and they will be called to bow down, but they will be unable.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: On the Day when the dreadful calamity will unfold, when people will be summoned to prostrate themselves, and yet they will not be able to prostrate.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: The Day when the Shin shall be laid bare and they shall be called to prostrate themselves, but they shall not be able to do so.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: On the day when it befalleth in earnest, and they are ordered to prostrate themselves but are not able,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: The day when the catastrophe occurs and they are summoned to prostrate themselves, they will not be able [to do it].

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: On the Day when the leg shall be bared, and they are ordered to prostrate themselves, they will be unable.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: The Day the shin will be uncovered and they are invited to prostration but the disbelievers will not be able,

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: On the day when the terrible torment approaches, they will be told (in a mocking way) to prostrate themselves, but they will not be able to do it.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: On the day when there shall be a severe affliction, and they shall be called upon to make obeisance, but they shall not be able,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Yawma yukshafu AAan saqin wayudAAawna ila alssujoodi fala yastateeAAoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: On the Day when the truth shall be laid bare, they will be called upon to prostrate themselves, but they will not be able to do so.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: The Day that the shin shall be laid bare, and they shall be summoned to bow in adoration, but they shall not be able,-

verses.text: خَاشِعَةً أَبْصَارُهُمْ‌ تَرْهَقُهُمْ‌ ذِلَّةٌ وَ قَدْ کَانُوا يُدْعَوْنَ‌ إِلَى‌ السُّجُودِ وَ هُمْ‌ سَالِمُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: دیدگانشان از شرم و حیا، فرو افتاده، خواری و ذلت آنان را فرا گیرد و اینان [در دنیا] به سجده [بر خدا] دعوت می شدند در حالی که تندرست بودند [ولی از فرمان خدا متکبرانه روی می گرداندند.]

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: وحشت در چشمانشان پيداست، ذلت بر آنها چيره شده است. پيش از اين نيز آنها را در عين تندرستى به سجده فراخوانده بودند.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: ديدگانشان [هراسان‌] به زير افتد و ذلت و خوارى وجودشان را فرا گيرد، در حالى كه [در دنيا] به وقت تندرستى به سجده دعوت مى‌شدند [ولى ابا مى‌كردند]

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: ديدگانشان به زير افتاده، خوارى آنان را فرو مى‌گيرد، در حالى كه [پيش از اين‌] به سجده دعوت مى‌شدند و تندرست بودند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: چشمانشان ذلیل و ترسان، ذلّت و حسرت آنها را فرا گرفته و از این پیش (در دنیا) با تن سالم به سجده خدا آنها را می‌خواندند (ولی اجابت نکردند).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: این در حالی است که چشمانشان (از خوف و وحشت و شرمندگی و شرمساری) به زیر افتاده است، و خواری و پستی وجود ایشان را فرا گرفته است. پیش از این نیز (در دنیا) بدان گاه که سالم و تندرست بودند به سجده بردن و کرنش کردن خوانده می‌شدند (و ایشان با وجود توانائی، سجده و کرنش نمی‌کردند). [[«خَاشِعَةً»: به زیر افتاده (نگا: قمر / 7). حال است. «تَرْهَقُهُمْ»: ایشان را در بر می‌گیرد. آنان را فرا می‌گیرد (نگا: یونس / 26 و 27).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: دیدگانشان [از ترس‌] فرو افتاده باشد، غبار خفت و خواری بر رخسارشان نشسته، و چنین بود که به سجده دعوت می‌شدند و تندرست بودند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: این در حالی است که چشمهایشان (از شدّت شرمساری) به زیر افتاده، و ذلّت و خواری وجودشان را فراگرفته؛ آنها پیش از این دعوت به سجود می‌شدند در حالی که سالم بودند (ولی امروز دیگر توانایی آن را ندارند)!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: سرافکنده باشد دیدگانشان چیره گردد بر ایشان خواری و همانا بودند دعوت می‌شدند به سجده‌کردن حالیکه بودند تندرستان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: در حالى كه ديدگانشان از ترس فروشده، خوارى و زبونى آنها را فرو گرفته است و همانا به سجود خوانده مى‌شدند و حال آنكه تندرست بودند- مى توانستند سجده كنند ولى اجابت نمى‌كردند-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: چشمانشان خاشعانه [:برهم] است و ذلت آنان را فراگرفته‌. در حالی که همواره به سجود دعوت می‌شدند (سجده نمی‌کردند) با آنکه سالم بودند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Lowered will be their eyes, disgrace overwhelming them. They had indeed been called to bow in homage when they were free of blame.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: With lowered eyes, disgrace overcoming them; and indeed they used to be called to prostrate themselves whilst they were healthy.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: humbled shall be their eyes, and abasement shall overspread them, for they had been summoned to bow themselves while they were whole.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Downcast will be their looks; abjectness will overspread them. Surely they had been called upon to Prostrate themselves while yet they were whole.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Their eyes will be cast down, ignominy will cover them; they used to be called to prostrate (offer prayers), while they were healthy and good (in the life of the world, but they did not).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Their eyes subdued, shame will cover them. They were invited to bow down when they were sound.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Their eyes shall be downcast and ignominy shall overwhelm them. For when they were safe and sound, they were summoned to prostrate themselves, (and they refused).

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Their eyes will be cast down and ignominy will cover them; they used to be called to prostrate themselves, while they were.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: With eyes downcast, abasement stupefying them. And they had been summoned to prostrate themselves while they were yet unhurt.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: With a humbled look [in their eyes], they will be overcast by abasement. Certainly, they were summoned to prostrate themselves while they were yet sound.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Their eyes will be humbled, and humiliation shall spread over them for they were already ordered to prostrate themselves when they were undiminished.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. And they used to be invited to prostration while they were sound.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Their eyes will be lowered and disgrace will cover them. They had certainly been told to prostrate themselves before God when they were safe and sound.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Their looks cast down, abasement shall overtake them; and they were called upon to make obeisance indeed while yet they were safe.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: KhashiAAatan absaruhum tarhaquhum thillatun waqad kanoo yudAAawna ila alssujoodi wahum salimoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Their eyes will be cast down and they will be covered in shame; they were bidden to prostrate themselves, when they were safe and sound [but they did not obey].

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Their eyes will be cast down,- ignominy will cover them; seeing that they had been summoned aforetime to bow in adoration, while they were whole, (and had refused).

verses.text: فَذَرْنِي‌ وَ مَنْ‌ يُکَذِّبُ‌ بِهٰذَا الْحَدِيثِ‌ سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُمْ‌ مِنْ‌ حَيْثُ‌ لاَ يَعْلَمُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس مرا با کسانی که این قرآن را انکار می کنند واگذار، به زودی ما آنان را به تدریج از آن جا که نمی دانند [به سوی عذاب] می کشانیم؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس مرا با آنها كه اين سخن را تكذيب مى‌كنند واگذار تا اندك‌اندك، چنان كه درنيابند، فروگيريمشان.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس مرا با كسى كه اين سخن [هاى قرآن‌] را تكذيب مى‌كند واگذار. ما به تدريج آنها را از آن جا كه نمى‌دانند گرفتار خواهيم ساخت

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
