translations.text: پس مرا با كسى كه اين گفتار را تكذيب مى‌كند واگذار. به تدريج آنان را به گونه‌اى كه در نيابند [گريبان‌] خواهيم گرفت،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (ای رسول، تو کیفر) مکذّبان و منکران قرآن را به من واگذار که ما آنها را از آنجا که نفهمند (و گمان نعمت کنند) به عذاب سخت در افکنیم.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: مرا واگذار با آنان که این کلام (آسمانی قرآن) را تکذیب می‌کنند. (من خود می‌دانم که با ایشان چه کار می‌کنم). ما آنان را اندک اندک به گونه‌ای که در نیابند و از راهی که متوجّه نشوند به سوی عذاب خواهیم کشاند. [[«الْحَدِیثِ»: سخن. مراد قرآن است (نگا: زمر / 23). «سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُمْ»: (نگا: اعراف / 182). «مِنْ حَیْثُ»: از آنجائی که. به گونه‌ای که.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس مرا با کسی که این سخن را تکذیب می‌کند، وابگذار، زودا که آهسته آهسته به نحوی که در نیابند، فرو خواهیمشان گرفت‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: اکنون مرا با آنها که این سخن را تکذیب می‌کنند واگذار! ما آنان را از آنجا که نمی‌دانند به تدریج به سوی عذاب پیش می‌بریم.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس بهل مرا با آنکه تکذیب کند بدین داستان زود است به آهستگیشان گیرم از آنجا که ندانند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس مرا با كسانى كه اين سخن- قرآن- را دروغ مى‌انگارند واگذار آنها را اندك اندك و پايه پايه از آنجا كه ندانند فرو گيريم- به هلاكت و نابودى كشانيم-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس مرا رها کن با کسی که به این حدیث (قرآن) تکذیب می‌کند. زودا (که) آنان را در عذاب پیاپی داخل می‌کنیم، بدان گونه که نمی‌دانند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So leave those who deny this Discourse to Me. We shall lead them step by step to (ruin) in a way they will not know.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Therefore leave the one who denies this matter, to Me; We shall soon steadily take them away, from a place they do not know.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So leave Me with him who cries lies to this discourse! We will draw them on little by little whence they know not;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Let Me alone with him who belieth this discourse; step by step We lead them on when they perceive not.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then leave Me Alone with such as belie this Quran. We shall punish them gradually from directions they perceive not.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So leave Me to those who reject this discourse; We will proceed against them gradually, from where they do not know.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: So leave Me, (O Prophet), to deal with him who gives the lie to this Discourse. We shall draw them little by little (to their undoing) in a way that they will not know.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then leave Me alone with whoever denies this narration. We shall punish them gradually from directions they perceive not.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Leave Me (to deal) with those who give the lie to this pronouncement. We shall lead them on by steps from whence they know not.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So leave Me with those who deny this discourse. We will draw them imperceptibly [into ruin], whence they do not know.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Therefore, leave Me with he who belied this discourse. We will draw them on little by little from where they do not know.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: So leave Me, [O Muhammad], with [the matter of] whoever denies the Qur'an. We will progressively lead them [to punishment] from where they do not know.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Leave those who reject the Quran to Me and I shall lead them step by step to destruction, without their being aware of it.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So leave Me and him who rejects this announcement; We will overtake them by degrees, from whence they perceive not:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fatharnee waman yukaththibu bihatha alhadeethi sanastadrijuhum min haythu la yaAAlamoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: So leave to Me those who reject this message. We shall lead them step by step to their ruin, in ways beyond their ken.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then leave Me alone with such as reject this Message: by degrees shall We punish them from directions they perceive not.

verses.text: وَ أُمْلِي‌ لَهُمْ‌ إِنَ‌ کَيْدِي‌ مَتِينٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و [البته] آنان را مهلت می دهیم [تا گناهشان را در حال بی خبری به نهایت برسانند]، بی تردید نقشه و تدبیر من استوار است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و به آنها مهلت دهم. هر آينه مكر من مكرى استوار است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و مهلتشان مى‌دهم كه نقشه من بسى محكم است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و مهلتشان مى‌دهم، زيرا تدبير من [سخت‌] استوار است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و آنها را مهلت دهم که البته کید من قوی و بسیار سخت است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و به آنان فرصت می‌دهم (و در عذابشان شتاب نخواهم کرد). نقشه و چاره‌جوئی من دقیق و استوار است (و کسی از آن رهائی ندارد). [[«أُمْلی»: (نگا: اعراف / 183، آل‌عمران / 178، رعد / 32).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و مهلتشان می‌دهم، زیرا تدبیر من سخت استوار است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و به آنها مهلت (بازگشت) می‌دهم؛ چرا که نقشه‌های من محکم و دقیق است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و نیرنگ کنم برای ایشان که نیرنگ من است استوار

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و آنان را مهلت دهم، كه تدبير من استوار است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و برایشان مهلت می‌دهیم. بی‌گمان کید من پای‌برجاست.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Yet I will give them respite: Surely My plan is compact.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And I will give them respite; indeed My plan is very solid.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and I shall respite them -- assuredly My guile is sure.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And I bear with them; verily My contrivance is sure.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And I will grant them a respite. Verily, My Plan is strong.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And I will give them respite. My plan is firm.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: I am giving them a respite. Great is My scheme!

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And I will grant them a respite. Verily, My plan is strong.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Yet I bear with them, for lo! My scheme is firm.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: I will grant them respite, for My devising is indeed sure.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: I shall respite them, My stratagem is firm.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And I will give them time. Indeed, My plan is firm.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: I shall give them respite, however, My plan is so strong that they will never be able to escape from it.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And I do bear with them, surely My plan is firm.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Waomlee lahum inna kaydee mateenun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: I shall grant them some respite, for My plan is powerful.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: A (long) respite will I grant them: truly powerful is My Plan.

verses.text: أَمْ‌ تَسْأَلُهُمْ‌ أَجْراً فَهُمْ‌ مِنْ‌ مَغْرَمٍ‌ مُثْقَلُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [اینکه دعوتت را نمی پذیرند] مگر از آنان در برابر ابلاغ رسالت پاداشی می طلبی که از خسارت و زیانش سنگین بارند؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: يا از آنان مزدى طلبيده‌اى و اكنون از اداى آن در رنجند؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا از آنها مزدى مى‌خواهى كه از پرداخت آن [عاجز و] گرانبار شده‌اند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا از آنان مزدى درخواست مى‌كنى، و آنان خود را زير بار تاوان، گرانبار مى‌يابند؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا تو از کافران امت مزد رسالت خواهی که بار غرامتش بر آنها گران است؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: چه بسا تو از ایشان (در برابر تبلیغ رسالت، بدون این که ما بدانیم) مزدی خواسته‌ای و پرداخت آن برای آنان سنگین است (و از ادای آن در رنج هستند؟!). [[«أَمْ تَسْأَلُهُمْ»: (نگا: طور / 40).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا مگر از آنان مزدی درخواست می‌کنی، و آنان خود را زیر بار تاوان، گرانبار می‌یابند؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: یا اینکه تو از آنها مُزدی می‌طلبی که پرداختش برای آنها سنگین است؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: یا پرسیشان پاداشی که ایشانند از هزینه سنگین‌باران‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: يا مگر از آنان مزدى مى‌خواهى كه از تاوان گرانبارند؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا از آنان اجری می‌خواهی، پس ایشان از زیانشان گران‌بارند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Do you ask for any compensation from them that they are burdened with want?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Or is it that you (O dear Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him) ask any fee from them, so they are burdened with the penalty?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Or askest thou them for a wage, and so they are weighed down with debt?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Askest thou a hire from them so that they are laden with debt?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Or is it that you (O Muhammad SAW) ask them a wage, so that they are heavily burdened with debt?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or do you ask them for a fee, so they are burdened with debt?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Or are you asking them for some compensation so that they feel burdened with debt?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Or is it that you ask them a wage, so that they are heavily burdened with debt

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or dost thou (Muhammad) ask a fee from them so that they are heavily taxed?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Do you ask them for a reward, so that they are weighed down with debt?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Or, do you ask them for a wage, so that they are burdened withdebt?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or do you ask of them a payment, so they are by debt burdened down?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), do you ask for your preaching any recompense which is too heavy a price for them to pay?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or do you ask from them a reward, so that they are burdened with debt?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Am tasaluhum ajran fahum min maghramin muthqaloona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Do you demand some recompense from them that would weigh them down with debt?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Or is it that thou dost ask them for a reward, so that they are burdened with a load of debt?-

verses.text: أَمْ‌ عِنْدَهُمُ‌ الْغَيْبُ‌ فَهُمْ‌ يَکْتُبُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: یا غیب نزد آنان است و آنان از روی آن] می نویسند [و خود با تکیه بر آن به ادعاهای خود یقین می کنند و به دیگران هم خبر می دهند؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: يا علم غيب مى‌دانند و آنهايند كه مى‌نويسند؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا [اسرار] غيب نزدشان است و آنها مى‌نويسند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: يا [علم‌] غيب پيش آنهاست و آنها مى‌نويسند؟

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: یا آنکه از عالم غیب آگاهند تا از آنجا چیزی بر نویسند؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: یا این که اسرار غیب پیش ایشان است و آنان (آنچه را که می‌گویند از روی آن) می‌نویسند؟! [[«أَمْ عِندَهُمُ الْغَیْبُ»: (نگا: مریم / 78).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: یا مگر علم و اسرار غیب با ایشان است و از روی آن می‌نویسند؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: یا اسرار غیب نزد آنهاست و آن را می‌نویسند (و به یکدیگر می‌دهند)؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: یا نزد ایشان است ناپیدا پس ایشان می‌نویسند

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: يا مگر نزدشان علم غيب است كه [آن را] مى‌نويسند- و به ديگران مى‌دهند-؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: یا نزدشان غیب است، پس ایشان (آن را) می‌نویسند؟

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Or do they have knowledge of the unknown which they copy down?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Or that they possess the hidden, so they are writing it?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Or is the Unseen in their keeping, and so they are writing it down?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Is with them the unseen, so that they write down?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Or that the Ghaib (unseen here in this Verse it means Al-Lauh Al-Mahfuz) is in their hands, so that they can write it down?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Or do they know the future, and so they write it down?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Or do they have any knowledge of the Unseen which they are now writing down?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Or that the Unseen is in their hands, so that they can write it down

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Or is the Unseen theirs that they can write (thereof)?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Do they possess [access to] the Unseen, so that they write it down?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Or, is the Unseen with them, and they are writing it down!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Or have they [knowledge of] the unseen, so they write [it] down?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Do they possess the knowledge of the unseen which confirms the truthfulness of their belief?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Or have they (the knowledge of) the unseen, so that they write (it) down?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Am AAindahumu alghaybu fahum yaktuboona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Is the unseen within their grasp so that they write it down?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Or that the Unseen is in their hands, so that they can write it down?

verses.text: فَاصْبِرْ لِحُکْمِ‌ رَبِّکَ‌ وَ لاَ تَکُنْ‌ کَصَاحِبِ‌ الْحُوتِ‌ إِذْ نَادَى‌ وَ هُوَ مَکْظُومٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس در برابر حکم و قضای پروردگارت [که هلاک کردن تدریجی این طاغیان است] شکیبا باش و مانند صاحب ماهی [یونس] مباش [که شتاب در آمدن عذاب را برای قومش خواست و به این علت در شکم ماهی محبوس شد] و در آن حال با دلی مالامال از اندوه، خدا را ندا داد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: در برابر فرمان پروردگارت صابر باش و چون صاحب ماهى مباش كه با دلى پراندوه ندا در داد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس بر حكم پروردگارت شكيبايى كن و مانند آن همدم ماهى (يونس) مباش آن‌گاه كه [خدايش را] ندا داد و سخت غمگين بود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس در [امتثال‌] حكم پروردگارت شكيبايى ورز، و مانند همدم ماهى [=يونس‌] مباش، آنگاه كه اندوه زده ندا درداد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: باز تو برای حکم خدای خود صبر کن و مانند صاحب ماهی (یونس که از خشم در عذاب امت تعجیل کرد) مباش که (عاقبت پشیمان شد و در ظلمت زندان شکم ماهی افتاد و) به حال غم و اندوه (خدا را بر نجات خود) خواند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: در برابر فرمان پروردگارت شکیبا باش (و در کار تبلیغ، مقاوم و استوار). و همسان یونس مباش که با دلی پر کینه و اندوه، خدا را به فریاد خواند (و خواهان تعجیل در عذاب قوم خود شد). [[«صَاحِبِ الْحُوتِ»: صاحب ماهی. مراد یونس است (نگا: انبیاء / 87 و 88، صافّات / 139 - 148). «مَکْظُومٌ»: پرکینه و خشم. پر غم و اندوه (نگا: یوسف / 84، نحل. 58، زخرف / 17).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پس در انتظار حکم پروردگارت شکیبایی کن و همانند صاحب ماهی [ یونس‌] مباش که [در تاریکی‌] ندا در داد و خشم فرو خورده بود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: اکنون که چنین است صبر کن و منتظر فرمان پروردگارت باش، و مانند صاحب ماهی [= یونس‌] مباش (که در تقاضای مجازات قومش عجله کرد و گرفتار مجازات ترک اولی شد) در آن زمان که با نهایت اندوه خدا را خواند.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس شکیبا شو برای فرمان پروردگار خویش و نباش مانند خداوند ماهی که بانگ برآورد و او بود از خشم گلوگیر

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس بر حكم پروردگار خود شكيبايى كن و مانند صاحب ماهى- يونس- مباش آنگاه كه با دلى پراندوه [در شكم ماهى‌] ندا داد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس برای حکم پروردگارت صبر کن، و مانند همراه ماهی [:یونس] مباش، چون (خدا را) ندا در داد در حالی که غضبش فرونشسته بود.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So wait with patience for the judgement of your Lord, and do not be like (onah) of the fish who called (to his Lord) when he was choked with anger.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Therefore wait for your Lord’s command, and do not be like the one of the fish; who cried out when he was distraught. (Prophet Yunus – peace be upon him.)

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: So be thou patient under the judgment of thy Lord, and be not as the Man of the Fish, when he called, choking inwardly.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Be patient thou, then, with thy Lord's judgment, and be thou not like him of the fish, when he cried out while he was in anguish.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So wait with patience for the Decision of your Lord, and be not like the Companion of the Fish, when he cried out (to Us) while he was in deep sorrow. (See the Quran, Verse 21:87).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: So wait patiently for the Decision of your Lord, and do not be like the Fellow of the Fish who cried out in despair.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: So bear with patience until the Judgement of your Lord comes, and do not belike the man in the fish (i.e., Jonah) who called out, choking with grief:

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So, wait with patience for the decision of your Lord, and be not like the Companion of the Fish when he cried out (to Us) while he was Makzum.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: But wait thou for thy Lord's decree, and be not like him of the fish, who cried out in despair.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So submit patiently to the judgement of your Lord, and do not be like the Man of the Fish who called out as he choked with grief.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: So be patient with the judgement of your Lord and do not be like the Companion of the Whale (Jonah), when he called out choking inwardly.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then be patient for the decision of your Lord, [O Muhammad], and be not like the companion of the fish when he called out while he was distressed.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Exercise patience until the promise of your Lord (to punish the unbelievers) comes true. Do not be like Jonah (who left his people without the permission of God; he wanted them to be punished immediately),

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So wait patiently for the judgment of your Lord, and be not like the companion of the fish, when he cried while he was in distress.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faisbir lihukmi rabbika wala takun kasahibi alhooti ith nada wahuwa makthoomun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Wait patiently for your Lord's judgement; do not be like the man who, having been swallowed by a whale, called out in distress.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So wait with patience for the Command of thy Lord, and be not like the Companion of the Fish,- when he cried out in agony.

verses.text: لَوْ لاَ أَنْ‌ تَدَارَکَهُ‌ نِعْمَةٌ مِنْ‌ رَبِّهِ‌ لَنُبِذَ بِالْعَرَاءِ وَ هُوَ مَذْمُومٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: اگر رحمت و لطفی از سوی پروردگارش او را در نیافته بود، یقیناً نکوهش شده به صحرایی بی آب و گیاه افکنده می شد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اگر نعمت پروردگارش نبود، در عين بد حالى به صحرايى بى‌آب و گياه مى‌افتاد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: اگر رحمت پروردگارش به او نرسيده بود، قطعا ملامت شده به صحرا افكنده مى‌شد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: اگر لطفى از جانب پروردگارش تدارك [حال‌] او نمى‌كرد، قطعاً نكوهش شده بر زمين خشك انداخته مى‌شد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: که اگر لطف و رحمت پروردگارش در نیافتی با نکوهش به صحرای بی‌آب و گیاه در افتادی (و هلاک شدی).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: اگر نعمت و رحمت پروردگارش به یاریش نشتافته و به دادش نرسیده بود (از شکم ماهی) حتماً به بیرون افکنده می‌شد و نکوهیده در بیابان برهوت رها می‌گردید. [[«تَدَارَکَهُ»: او را دریافت. به دادش رسید. «لَنُبِذَ»: حتماً انداخته می‌شد. قطعاً رها می‌گردید و به خود واگذار می‌شد. «الْعَرَآءِ»: بیابان برهوت. صحرای خالی از گیاه و درخت (نگا: صافّات / 145). «وَ هُوَ مَذْمُومٌ»: در حالی که نکوهیده بود. در حالی که مورد مذمّت و ملامت قرار می‌گرفت.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: اگر نعمتی از جانب پروردگارش او را دستگیری نمی‌کرد، به کرانه‌[ی بی‌آب و علف‌] افکنده شده بود و قابل ملامت بود

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و اگر رحمت خدا به یاریش نیامده بود، (از شکم ماهی) بیرون افکنده می‌شد در حالی که نکوهیده بود!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: اگر نه دریافته بودش نعمتی از پروردگارش هرآینه افکنده می‌شد به دشت و می‌بود او نکوهیده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: اگر نه آن بود كه نعمتى- بخشايش و نيكو داشتى- از پروردگارش او را دريافت هر آينه به صحرايى بى‌گياه افكنده مى‌شد و نكوهيده مى‌بود.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: اگر نعمتی از پروردگارش او را در نیافته بود، بی‌گمان در بیابان (خشک و بی‌آب و گیاه) افکنده می‌شد در حالی که مذموم بود.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Had it not been for a favour from his Lord he would have been cast blame-worthy on a barren plain.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Were it not for his Lord’s favour that reached him, he would have surely been cast onto the desolate land, reproached.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Had there not overtaken him a blessing from his Lord he would have been cast upon the wilderness, being condemned.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Had not grace from his Lord reached him, he had surely been cast into the wilderness in a plight.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Had not a Grace from his Lord reached him, he would indeed have been (left in the stomach of the fish, but We forgave him), so he was cast off on the naked shore, while he was to be blamed.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Were it not for his Lord’s favor that reached him, he would have been thrown into the wilderness, fully despised.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: had his Lord not bestowed His favour upon him, he would have been cast upon that barren shore (and would have remained there) in disgrace.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Had not a grace from his Lord reached him, he would indeed have been (left in the stomach of the fish, but We forgave him), so he was cast off on the naked shore, while he was to be blamed.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Had it not been that favour from his Lord had reached him he surely had been cast into the wilderness while he was reprobate.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Had it not been for a blessing that came to his rescue from his Lord, he would surely have been cast on the bare shore, being blameworthy.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Had the favor of his Lord not come upon him, he would have been blamed, cast upon the shore.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: If not that a favor from his Lord overtook him, he would have been thrown onto the naked shore while he was censured.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and who cried (for help) to his Lord, while imprisoned and helpless inside the fish. Had it not been for a favor from his Lord, he would have been left out in the open, deserving blame for his shortcomings.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Were it not that favor from his Lord had overtaken him, he would certainly have been cast down upon the naked Found while he was blamed.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Lawla an tadarakahu niAAmatun min rabbihi lanubitha bialAAarai wahuwa mathmoomun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Had his Lord's grace not been bestowed upon him, he would have been cast away in disgrace upon that desolate shore.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Had not Grace from his Lord reached him, he would indeed have been cast off on the naked shore, in disgrace.

verses.text: فَاجْتَبَاهُ‌ رَبُّهُ‌ فَجَعَلَهُ‌ مِنَ‌ الصَّالِحِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس پروردگارش او را برگزید و از شایستگان قرار داد

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پس پروردگارش او را برگزيد و در زمره صالحانش آورد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: سپس پروردگارش وى را برگزيد و از شايستگانش قرار داد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس پروردگارش وى را برگزيد و از شايستگانش گردانيد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: باز (چون به درگاه حق نالید) خدایش برگزید و از صالحانش گردانید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پروردگارش (با پذیرش توبه‌اش مجدّداً) او را برگزید و از زمره‌ی شایستگانش کرد. [[«إجْتَبَاهُ رَبُّهُ»: پروردگارش او را برای اتمام رسالتش بر گزید.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس پروردگارش او را برگزید و از شایستگانش قرار داد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ولی پروردگارش او را برگزید و از صالحان قرار داد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس برگزیدش پروردگارش و گردانیدش از شایستگان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس پروردگارش او را برگزيد و از نيكان و شايستگانش ساخت.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس پروردگارش او را برگزید و از شایستگانش نهاد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then his Lord chose him and placed him among the upright.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: His Lord therefore chose him and made him among those deserving His proximity.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: But his Lord had chosen him, and He placed him among the righteous.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then his Lord chose him and made him of the righteous.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: But his Lord chose him and made him of the righteous.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But his Lord chose him, and made him one of the righteous.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: But his Lord exalted him, and included him among His righteous servants.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then his Lord chose him and made him of the righteous.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: But his Lord chose him and placed him among the righteous.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So his Lord chose him and made him one of the righteous.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: But his Lord had chosen him and He placed him among the righteous.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And his Lord chose him and made him of the righteous.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: But his Lord chose him as His Prophet and made him one of the righteous ones.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then his Lord chose him, and He made him of the good.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faijtabahu rabbuhu fajaAAalahu mina alssaliheena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: But his Lord chose him for His own and made him one of the righteous.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Thus did his Lord choose him and make him of the Company of the Righteous.

verses.text: وَ إِنْ‌ يَکَادُ الَّذِينَ‌ کَفَرُوا لَيُزْلِقُونَکَ‌ بِأَبْصَارِهِمْ‌ لَمَّا سَمِعُوا الذِّکْرَ وَ يَقُولُونَ‌ إِنَّهُ‌ لَمَجْنُونٌ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و کافران چون قرآن را شنیدند، نزدیک بود تو را با چشمانشان بلغزانند [و از پای درآورند] و می گویند: بی تردید او دیوانه است!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و كافران چون قرآن را شنيدند نزديك بود كه تو را با چشمان خود به سر درآورند و مى‌گويند كه او ديوانه است،

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و همانا كسانى كه كافر شدند، وقتى كه قرآن را شنيدند، نزديك بود تو را با چشمان [خشمگين‌] خود از جاى بركنند، و مى‌گويند: او حتما ديوانه است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و آنان كه كافر شدند، چون قرآن را شنيدند چيزى نمانده بود كه تو را چشم بزنند، و مى‌گفتند: «او واقعاً ديوانه‌اى است.»

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: البته نزدیک است که کافران به چشمان (بد) خود (چشم زخمت زنند و) از پایت در آورند، آن گاه که آیات قرآن بشنوند و (چون در فصاحتش حیرت کنند از شدت حسد) گویند که این شخص عجب دیوانه است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: نزدیک است کافران هنگامی که آیات قرآن را می‌شنوند، تو را با چشمان (خیره و زل زده‌ی) خود به سر درآورند و هلاک سازند، و می‌گویند: او قطعاً دیوانه است. [[«لَیُزْلِقُونَکَ»: این که تو را نقش زمین سازند و نابودت کنند. تو را از زمین بردارند. حرف (لَ) برای تأکید نزدیکی ایشان به اقدام هلاک کردن و نابود کردن است. در میان عربها کنایه از شدّت کینه‌توزی و دشمنانگی است. «الذِّکْرَ»: قرآن.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و بسیار نزدیک بود که کافران چون قرآن را شنیدند، تو را با دیدگانشان آسیب برسانند و گفتند او دیوانه است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: نزدیک است کافران هنگامی که آیات قرآن را می‌شنوند با چشم‌زخم خود تو را از بین ببرند، و می‌گویند: «او دیوانه است!»

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و همانا نزدیک است آنان که کفر ورزیدند بلغزانندت با دیدگان خویش هنگامی که شنیدند ذکر را و گویند او است دیوانه‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه نزديك است آنان كه كافر شدند- چون قرآن را شنيدند- كه مى‌خواندى- تو را با چشمهاى خود بلغزانند و بيفكنند و مى‌گويند: همانا او ديوانه است-.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و بی‌گمان کسانی که کافر شدند، نزدیکند بی‌امان تو را به هنگامی که ذکر [:قرآن] را شنیدند با چشم‌هایشان متزلزل کنند، و گویند او همواره بس مجنون است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But the unbelievers would like to stare you out of balance when they hear the warning, and say: "Surely he is possessed;"

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And indeed the disbelievers seem as if they would topple you with their evil gaze when they hear the Qur’an, and they say, “He is indeed insane.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: The unbelievers wellnigh strike thee down with their glances, when they hear the Reminder, and they say, 'Surely he is a man possessed!'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And those who disbelieve well-nigh cause thee to stumble with their looks when they hear the Admonition, and they say: verily he is mad.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And verily, those who disbelieve would almost make you slip with their eyes through hatredness when they hear the Reminder (the Quran), and they say: "Verily, he (Muhammad SAW) is a madman!"

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Those who disbelieve almost stab you with their glances when they hear the message, and say, “He is crazy!”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: When the unbelievers hear this Exhortation, they look at you as though they would knock you off your feet with their (hostile) glances. They say: “Surely he is afflicted with madness”;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And verily, those who disbelieve would almost make you slip with their eyes (through hatred) when they hear the Reminder (the Qur'an), and they say: "Verily, he is a madman!"

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And lo! those who disbelieve would fain disconcert thee with their eyes when they hear the Reminder, and they say: Lo! he is indeed mad;

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed the faithless almost devour you with their eyes when they hear this Reminder, and they say, ‘He is indeed crazy.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: When the unbelievers hear the Reminder, they nearly strike you down with their glances, and say: 'Surely, he is mad'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And indeed, those who disbelieve would almost make you slip with their eyes when they hear the message, and they say, "Indeed, he is mad."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: When the disbelievers listen to you reciting the Quran they almost try to destroy you with their piercing eyes. Then they say, "He is certainly insane".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And those who disbelieve would almost smite you with their eyes when they hear the reminder, and they say: Most surely he is mad.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wain yakadu allatheena kafaroo layuzliqoonaka biabsarihim lamma samiAAoo alththikra wayaqooloona innahu lamajnoonun

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: When those who deny the truth hear the admonition, they would almost cause you to stumble with their evil eyes; and they say, "He is certainly mad."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And the Unbelievers would almost trip thee up with their eyes when they hear the Message; and they say: "Surely he is possessed!"

verses.text: وَ مَا هُوَ إِلاَّ ذِکْرٌ لِلْعَالَمِينَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: در حالی که قرآن جز مایه تذکر و پند برای جهانیان نیست.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و حال آنكه قرآن براى جهانيان جز اندرزى نيست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و حال آن كه [قرآن‌] جز تذكارى براى جهانيان نيست

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و حال آنكه [قرآن‌] جز تذكارى براى جهانيان نيست.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: در حالی که این کتاب الهی جز ذکر و پند و حکمت برای عالمیان هیچ نیست.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: در صورتی که قرآن جز اندرز و پند جهانیان و مایه‌ی بیداری و هوشیاری ایشان نیست. [[«ذِکْرٌ»: اندرز و پند. مایه بیداری و هوشیاری.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و حال آنکه آن جز پندی برای جهانیان نیست‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: در حالی که این (قرآن) جز مایه بیداری برای جهانیان نیست!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و نیست او جز ذکری از برای جهانیان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و نيست اين [قرآن‌] مگر ياد و پندى براى جهانيان.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: در حالی که او جز یادواره‌ای برای جهانیان نیست.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Whilst it is no more than reminder for the people of the world.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Whereas it is not but an advice to the entire creation!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And it is nothing but a Reminder unto all beings.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: While it is naught but an admonition Unto the worlds.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: But it is nothing else than a Reminder to all the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But it is no less than a reminder to all the Worlds.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: although this is nothing but an Exhortation (to goodness) for everyone in the world.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: But it is nothing else than a Reminder to all the creatures (`Alamin).

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: When it is naught else than a Reminder to creation.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Yet it is just a reminder for all the nations.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: But it is nothing other than a Reminder for all the worlds.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But it is not except a reminder to the worlds.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The Quran is nothing but a reminder from God to mankind.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And it is naught but a reminder to the nations.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wama huwa illa thikrun lilAAalameena

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Yet it is purely an admonition to mankind.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But it is nothing less than a Message to all the worlds.
